English.game_version_scroller:
Welcome to Dusk! Play as one of 38 unique Heroes, with unique abilities and special items!
As always, see the official changelog on the Workshop page for more information.

This version brings a huge amount of changes. Check the Steam Workshop page for way more information, as above.
English.new_hero_changelog:
Balthasar

Guardian of the Emerald Flame

A bully in lane and a bully in game, Balthasar is a dangerous and terrifying Hero, capable of chasing down opponents that would normally outrun or outrange their foes. His set of abilities allow him to strike from a distance with Firebolt, create a line of burning ground that grants him extreme movespeed with Doomflame, deal a portion of his attack damage as damage over time with Emerald Fang, and slow and damage his opponents in a large area, while revealing invisible enemies, with Ward of the Emerald Flame.


Siegfried

the Knight of Purgatory

A dangerous foe and valuable ally, the Demonfire Knight commands respect from his enemies in battle, and his abilities feature the duality of action and consequence. With time-bending AoE slows in Eon Shield Hell Bent granting him a frenzied onslaught of attacks, magic immunity upon spell cast with Epoch's Protection and the ability to globally assist an ally for a short time with the use of Heaven Sent, Siegfried is extremely dangerous and difficult to deal with when played correctly, but his insistence on being in the fray makes him the prime target for burst damage and disables.
English.hero_changelog:
Patch 2.14a:

Balthasar


Level 20 Talent changed from +500 Doomflame Range to Doomflame Free Pathing.
Level 25 Talent +600 Ward of the Emerald Flame Radius reduced to +350.
Base movespeed reduced to 310 (was 315).
Base Health regen reduced to 0.5 (was 1.0).
Base Mana regen reduced to 0.5 (was 1.0).
Base damage reduced to 48 - 51 (was 51 - 52).
Base Armor increased by 1.
Night vision reduced to 800 (was 1000).

Lupin


Beneath the Mask slow increased to 8/14/20/26% (was 8/12/16/20%).
Beneath the Mask duration reduced to 2.5/3.0/3.5/4.0s (was 2/3/4/5s).
Beneath the Mask now renders Lupin invisible, with no fade time, for the duration. Attacking, using items, or casting Spells does not reveal Lupin.
Finisher cooldown reduced to 3s (was 9/8/7/6s).
Finisher damage reduced to 30/60/90/120 (was 40/80/120/160).
Finisher Mana cost reduced to 30/40/50/60 (was 75).
Finisher slow duration reduced to 0.50s (was 0.75s).

Patch 2.14:

Fury

Roar duration reduced to 4s (was 5.25s).
Berserk duration increased to 6s (was 4.5/5.0/5.5s).
Berserk cooldown increased to 80/60/40s (was 60/50/40s).
Berserk no longer grants bonus Rend and Bloodsport stacks.
Berserk now prevents Fury's Health from dropping below 1 while it's active.
Rend and Bloodsport no longer function on illusions.
Rend and Bloodsport are now disabled by Break.
Talent: Level 25 +4s Berserk Duration (was +3s Berserk Duration).


Shade

Dark Hunger now grants Health and Mana based on the damage Shade deals (from any source). 10/15/20/25% of damage is converted to Health and Mana restored. Only 1/4th effective against creeps.
Stalk now only deals Pure damage.
Stalk damage increased to 50/100/150/200.
Stalk cooldown reduced to 24/18/12/6s.
Isolation no longer Silences.
Isolation now applies a 25% slow.
Isolation now reduces damage output by 60% (was 50%).


Phantasm

Shadowstep cooldown increased to 60s (was 50/40/30/20s).
Shadowstep delay time rescaled to 4.00/3.25/2.50/1.75s (was 3.00s).
Shadowstep bonus movespeed increased to 30% (was 25%).
Shadowstep now grants Phased movement and free pathing for the duration.
Shadowstep now applies a Basic Dispel upon teleportation.
Nightmare now also prevents the target's allies from helping them with targeted Spells and Items.


War

Bloodlust duration reduced to 10 ticks (was 14 ticks).
Bloodlust damage reduced to 15/25/35/45 (was 12/24/36/48).
Bloodlust now slows by 15%.
Bloodlust now ticks once every 0.75s (instead of once every 1.00s).
Bloodlust is now removed if the affected unit kills a non-Illusion Hero, and is removed from all Heroes if War dies.
Bloodlust does not tick down while attacking under the effects of War's Ultimate.
Earthbreaker damage reduced to 75/125/175/225 (was 100/150/200/250).
Earthbreaker stun changed to 1.50s (was 1.00/1.35/1.70/2.05s).
Earthbreaker mana cost is now 75 (was 55/65/75/85).
Earthbreaker radius reduced to 300 (was 325).
Level 15 Talent changed to +100 Earthbreaker Radius (was +25 Berserker Aura AS/MS)
Level 20 Talent reduced to +25 Bloodlust DPS (was +35)
Level 25 Talent changed to -4s Earthbreaker Cooldown (was +200 Earthbreaker Radius)
English.misc_changelog:
Patch 2.14a:
Fixed non-vanilla Talents not functioning properly.
Balthasar's Level 25 Talent has been corrected to -8s Firebolt Cooldown instead of -12s Cooldown.

Patch 2.14:
Lysander has been temporarily disabled following a number of crashes related to his abilities.
Fixed Alexander's Level 25 Talent not healing nearby allies.
Fixed Paragon's Level 25 Talent not increasing Tranquility Seal's duration.
Fixed Alroth's Solwave particle effect lingering past the actual duration.
Fixed some missing animations for Bloodwarrior and Erra.
Fixed Rage Potion not functioning properly.
Fixed Ironblood Potion not functioning properly.
English.npc_dota_hero_bounty_hunter_bio: Few possess a reputation capable of striking fear into the Arca of the realm, but the Nightwalker was one. A veteran assassin, and a slayer of countless mages, he tore across Lochraith at the drop of a coin, seemingly unstoppable. Not all lives were his, however; a young Arca had seen him coming days in advance, and set a devious trap. Caught in a powerful binding spell, he prepared to take his last breath, but the Arca hesitated. For all the trouble he had caused, all those he had killed in the name of avarice, he deserved worse than death. His punishment would forever be wandering a dark void, unable to escape, with no need for material goods, with no quarries to find. She hastily weaved a dark, terrible curse, full of isolation and solitude. But curses are fickle creatures, born of terrible, turbulent emotions. She realised her mistake all but a second too late. Using the very threads she had weaved prior, the Nightwalker tore her from the plane, imprisoning her in a desolate realm, using his undying connection with her to weave dark magic of his own.
English.npc_dota_hero_dark_seer_bio: White, pockmarked knuckles gripped the wooden frame. A glint in the dark; eyes darting to and fro, surveying their surroundings carefully for any sign of movement. A moment later, the figure slipped into the shadows of the room, the door closing gently behind him. Many had come to seek the Lost One, to destroy him and the twisted reality he represented. This man, however, was different. He sought more than simple destruction. He wished to learn the Lost One's ways, and become powerful. So was born the Ironfist; master of every method of fighting.
English.npc_dota_hero_vengefulspirit_bio: There is an old folktale the Tijadi pass down, of a mother and her young child. The child could speak to Spirits, but should they utter a word in return, they would be wrenched of their immortality, left weak and vulnerable. The Marqas, arbiters of order, deemed her child cursed, and banished her to the Nothing. As the darkness twisted around her, pulling every cell from her body for an agonising eternity, the true nature of her curse was discovered. The spirits of the old land began to die, one by one, their souls fading as the child's did. In a panicked realisation of their mistakes, the Marqas pulled her from her prison and tasked her with wandering the planes and restoring the dead or mortal Spirits, bestowing upon her incredible powers of regeneration and fighting prowess.
English.npc_dota_hero_lycan_bio: The ancient tribes of Iyat, once spanning the sundered plains, passed down many tales. One of which was that of the Great One, an elder of elders, their whim bending reality around them, their heart a roaring flame. It is said that their son grew jealous of such power, and wished to gain it for himself. Whenever asked, the Great One only spake: 'in due time.'As the son's jealousy grew, he devised a plan. Using the essence of envy, he forged a weapon: a blade of emerald fury, with the power to extract the abilities of the Great One. One night, he snuck into the Great One's keep, and went to strike him down with his blade. However, the Great One was prepared; he had seen his son forging this monstrosity. As the son landed the final blow, the Great One uttered a curse, sealing his soul into the sword itself. The son could not extract the powers, no matter how hard he tried. Defeated by his failures, he took his own life using that same blade. Yet death did not come easily to him; instead, the Emerald Blade and the Flame of the Great One combined, creating a jade flame. The son's form dissipated, and he was transformed into a creature of the night, a protector of the fire: The Wolf of the Emerald Flame.
English.npc_dota_hero_arc_warden_bio: A being from a forgotten Plane, the creature known only as 'Baal' foresaw that which his kind did not; the End. In his dreams he saw fire descending upon his people, destroying all that he knew. His fears came to a head, and with the help of others, he put a plan in motion; before the cataclysmic event, he would drag his world into the next Plane, and deal with the consequences afterwards. The event began as his dream foretold: a being of light and fire had formed, infantile and oblivious, its light singeing the edges of his home. With a cry, he and his comrades used all of their might to push their home through the warping walls of the Plane. All seemed well, until the gap widened, and an unfathomable force tore at the Plane. His home began to crumble as it fell through, and he watched with horror as the being of fire was torn from its celestial cradle, its form washing over and searing all that he knew to ash. As he fell into this new plane, his anger and guilt consumed him, his physical form a self imposed prison for his transgressions against his own kind.
English.npc_dota_hero_sven_bio: Once a member of Epoch's Counsel, a group of knights and mages selected by a god's hand, Siegfried was known as the Protector of All, the Right Hand of Epoch. Wielding a shield that could twist time itself, and a sword that could bend space to his will, his influence spanned centuries upon centuries, helping the weak and purging evil from the lands. When another member, the Mouthpiece of Epoch, began plotting against the people in His name, Siegfried tried all he could to stop him, and to prove Epoch's continued love for humanity, despite the Mouthpiece's mad ramblings of power and destruction. As each of his fellow Counsel members turned against him, Siegfried had but one option remaining: travel to the deepest pits of the Below, obtain the Demon's Fire, absorbing it into his sword, and use its power to cut through Epoch's protection, ridding the world of the treacherous Mouthpiece. Upon his return, he went to strike the Mouthpiece to find he had been tricked. His blade, possessed by the Fire's malicious intent, cut down every member of the Counsel as he weeped, leaving him the sole survivor. He now travels, cursed sword in one hand, and the time-bending Eon Shield in the other, seeking to atone to Epoch for his sins...
English.npc_dota_hero_omniknight_hype: A healer of mind and body, and a destroyer of his enemies, Paragon can entirely negate damage with his Tranquil Seal, staunchly defend himself with Divine Armour, heal his allies or damage his enemies with Cleanse, and inflict massive amounts of Pure damage globally with Smite.
English.npc_dota_hero_aeronaut_hype: A powerful Agility Hero that relies on striking from a distance to deal the most damage possible. While he is fragile, his mobility is unmatched, and with the power of flight (and a few core items), he is nigh unstoppable.
English.npc_dota_hero_bounty_hunter_hype: Shade is a powerful Agility Hero that relies on his enemies being isolated to deal his damage. His blades are coated in Darkwyrm Venom, dealing damage based on the amount of debuffs his opponent has. He can Stalk a target to inflict a large amount of Physical damage and slow, and he can sustain in fights with his terrifying Dark Hunger. His Ultimate, Isolation, may remove an enemy from their allies, crippling their ability to deal damage.
English.npc_dota_hero_lich_hype: A progenitor of frost magic, The Lich freezes his foes with reckless abandon, crushing them with powerful long range disables, close range nukes, a devastating Aura, and a global chill that slows enemies drastically.
English.npc_dota_hero_sniper_hype: A sharpshooter with a focus on dangerous equipment, Hawkeye matches his explosive madness with equally explosive abilities. Double Tap is a great mid-range nuke, and he has access to powerful escape in the form of Hit 'n' Run. His Ultimate, Detonator Dart, is a devastating delayed nuke that also stuns.
English.npc_dota_hero_rubick_hype: Eccentric, perhaps, but undoubtably skilled, the Voidwalker can crush opposition with a set of dangerous abilities, including a purging bolt of pure energies, a portal that can transport allies to anywhere on the map, a pact with a being from beyond, and a terrifying vortex of abyssal energies that pulls enemies into the centre with ease.
English.npc_dota_hero_ursa_hype: A scary bear. Difficult to run from once he gets a few hits off, Fury is a powerful ganker and carry due to his incredible Bloodsport and Rend abilities, a damage over time per hit and max health reduction per hit, respectively. His Q is Roar, empowering him for each unit hit in its AoE for bonus attack speed, movespeed and damage, and his Ultimate makes him attack even faster and augments the power of his Rend and Bloodsport. A true force of nature.
English.npc_dota_hero_spectre_hype: A spectral form that can barely be perceived, Phantasm may be fragile, but she is an incredibly powerful manfighter and late game carry. Possessing a cleave that increases its damage the more times it hits, an excellent scaling AoE nuke/slow that is based on her Attribute total, a devastating critical strike that deals more damage the lower Health the target is on, and a long range teleport that allows her to quickly close the distance against even the most elusive foes, Phantasm is a powerful and terrifying Hero.
English.npc_dota_hero_dark_seer_hype: Master of many arts, Ironfist is a powerful adversary. Equipped with three sets of skills that he can switch between, and three modes: tank, high damage or speed, Ironfist is capable of adapting to most situations very quickly.
English.npc_dota_hero_vengefulspirit_hype: The healer in chief, Elena is an excellent sustainer with incredible teamfight capabilities. Possessing damaging/healing AoEs and an Ultimate that turns the opponents' attacks against them, she is difficult to deal with in any case.
English.npc_dota_hero_juggernaut_hype: A powerful master swordsman, hailing from the land of spirits, Mifune has access to an array of extraordinary abilities, one of which being the devastating Zanmato, a strike that deals more damage to the target the more units are around them.
English.npc_dota_hero_rattletrap_hype: The sieger of towers, destroyer of bases, and overall one of the most annoying Heroes to play against, Vulcan is a defensive core that can place nests of units all over the map. His Tesla Coils are weak on their own, but in groups they are devastatingly powerful, and the Sentinel can down towers in a short time. His Vassal, built with an innate ability, can help him kill enemies with its wide set of powerful spells, but is fragile and slow.
English.npc_dota_hero_keeper_of_the_light_hype: Keeper of timelines, the Timekeeper is difficult to use but rewarding when used correctly. Able to deal random damage after a random delay, slow enemies drastically, have a chance to reduce his and his allies' cooldowns, and save/load an ally's position, Health and Mana, Timekeeper is a powerful and dependable support.
English.npc_dota_hero_phantom_assassin_hype: A nuker with an emphasis on spammable abilities, Lightning is a quickfire Hero that allows very little to stand in her way. Crush your enemies with short range, extremely low cooldown nukes with Lightning Daggers, a powerful, long range and explosive blast of lightning in Boltblast, a pulse of slowing electrical energy with Overload, and augment all of the above with her Spark, dealing damage whenever she casts them.
English.npc_dota_hero_jakiro_hype: A sturdy and dependable nuker, Ouroboros is tanky and destructive, capable of disrupting fights and single handedly taking down most enemies, should they be struck by his slow moving skills. Possessing fire breath in the form of Searing Fire, a powerful stun in Nexus, scales that convert Magical damage he takes to Spell Amp and attack damage, and a devastating Ultimate that causes his Spells to be cast twice in quick succession.
English.npc_dota_hero_tinker_hype: An extremely dangerous nuker, Tek can crush most opposition with a great deal of Magical damage very quickly. His Skycrack is a low cooldown nuke+slow, Mosquito Missiles deals a huge amount of damage spread between available targets, Quantum Vibrance Engine causes his attacks to become more dangerous as he builds up charges from using his abilities, and his Ultimate is a powerful uninterruptable AoE stun.
English.npc_dota_hero_kunkka_hype: This cap'n is all about disrupting his enemies. His long range Physical nuke, Grapeshot, makes him great at consistently damaging enemies. Captain's Compass grants him bonus movespeed whilst moving towards his enemies, whilst Adventurous Gale allows him to charge forth and carry enemies with him. Should he be in trouble, he can summon the great Dreadnaught, a ghostly ship that fires numerous cannonballs ahead of it.
English.npc_dota_hero_bloodseeker_hype: A difficult to kill right-clicker with a wide subset of abilities. Able to shower enemies in blood to grant Lifesteal to his allies, slow and steal Strength from targets, strike with his vital force, and ingest his own blood to enter a maddened state for a short time.
English.npc_dota_hero_wisp_hype: A support with a set of skills designed to save allies and annoy enemies, Aether can drag an ally out of a bad situation with Teleport, deal damage and disjoint projectiles with Disrupt, place buffing Monoliths with Monolith, and suck all enemies and allies in the immediate area into a dimensional safe zone.
English.npc_dota_hero_sand_king_hype: A sieger and teamfighter, Set functions best in messy fights where he will not be interrupted whilst channelling his devastating An Army Beneath the Sands. Focused on creating powerful Sand Puppets through his Sands of War and Ultimate, he can quickly push down towers if not kept in check. His Harsh Sun passive grants him bonus regeneration and slows enemies' attack speed during the day, globally.
English.npc_dota_hero_oracle_hype: Fate is an extremely difficult but highly rewarding character to use. Frail and slow, but possessing a multitude of devastating spells that can function as both support or offensive abilities, Fate can destroy most enemies given enough space in a fight. Wrap your opponents in chains that bond their destinies together, dealing damage as nearby units take damage, reduce the damage your allies take with Displace, heal and damage in an AoE with Realign, and grant you, or an ally, the stat power of extra levels, with Ancestral Recall.
English.npc_dota_hero_elder_titan_hype: Not many Heroes can claim to have as much visceral impact with their abilities as Reus. Rending the earth itself asunder, Reus may fire stunning rocks with Stoneblast, create slowing and damaging tremors with Magnitude, wallop enemies into next week with Gaia's Fury, and trap his enemies and allies in an arena that is impossible to escape-- buffing himself in the process-- with Ancient Arena.
English.npc_dota_hero_tusk_hype: Fast and furious, Hero is a get-in-get-out Hero with a fun to use skillset. Kick your enemies away with Justice Kick to set up for your pouncing Freedom Strike, break out of stuns and purgable disables with Heroic Soul, and obliterate your targets with the famed ONE PUNCH!!
English.npc_dota_hero_terrorblade_hype: Possessing a good balance of Physical and Magical damage, Bahamut is a powerful mid-game Agility carry. Turn your enemies into a walking radiance with Desolation, increase the damage they take with Reckoning Aura, deal ever increasing Magical damage with Fulmination, and finish the fight with the obliterating Mega Flare.
English.npc_dota_hero_arc_warden_hype: A positional manipulator as masterful as they are irritating, Baal's job is to constantly keep the enemy on their toes. Create a sphere that gradually slows enemies' attack and movement speed, anchor them to the ground with Spatiotemporal Anchor, teleport to a location after channelling with Spatial Rift, and enter a state of uncertainty to wreak havoc on your unsuspecting enemies with Superposition.
English.npc_dota_hero_night_stalker_hype: Horror is a dangerous ganker, capable of forcing enemies to run away from him with Terrify, blind them with Obscure, cause them to isolate themselves from their allies with Paranoia, and teleport to anyone he can see with Sinister.
English.npc_dota_hero_legion_commander_hype: A pusher and teamfighter, Neith's capabilities are devastating in the first 20 minutes of the game. Steal your opponents' attack damage with Monsoon, crush them solo with Decisive Strike, increase your allies' attack damage with Inspire, and Rally your creeps and Heroes to take tower after tower!
English.npc_dota_hero_dragon_knight_hype: A servant of her Radiance, former paladin and wielder of the legendary Godfall, Alexander is a tanky and difficult to deal with carry that can buff allies, Break and Silence enemies, heal himself and demolish those who would dare stand against him with his Ultimate.
English.npc_dota_hero_doom_bringer_hype: A commander of fire and ash, the being known as Alroth brings a great deal to the table when it comes to Magical damage. Boasting an array of abilities like the area of effect damage over time Maelstrom, instant cast Health draining explosion Energy Burst, Magic Resistance breaking Shatter, and powerful close range DoT Solwave, Alroth is capable of dealing with enemies his way, and no one else's.
English.npc_dota_hero_abaddon_hype: A supportive tank, Odin's claim to fame is his legendary spear, Gungnir. Capable of being cast globally, this has a short delay before landing and stunning and damaging anyone in the radius. Otherwise, he possesses a great escape tool in Sleipnir's Veil, a difficult to get around defense against right clickers in Oppression, and a powerful True Sight AoE spell that punishes invisible units in Eye of Truth.
English.npc_dota_hero_antimage_hype: A late game carry, Astaroth's job is to hit you five times with his Black Insignia to deal his damage. What he lacks in sturdiness he more than makes up for in spells, with access to a slow that activates upon the target taking damage (Pain Curse), that transforms the target into a walking bomb (Overwhelm), and a devastating Ultimate that does its best to erase their existence (Erase).
English.npc_dota_hero_techies_hype: The meaning of madness, Gob Squad cares not for self-preservation, only for destruction. Firing long range rockets with Rocket Blast is where the sanity ends-- the rest of their skillset is dangerous for everyone. Become extremely fast, then explode, with Kamikaze. Throw numerous bombs out of your cart with their Ultimate, Clearance Sale, and of course... explode anyway on death, with Whoops!!
English.npc_dota_hero_axe_hype: A tank with access to a powerful stun in Earthbreaker and damage over time with Bloodlust, War is a dangerous Hero to play against. He is difficult to kill, and his Ultimate, Fight Me!, makes him even more disruptive, turning his opponent's damage against them.
English.npc_dota_hero_enigma_hype: A disabler, nuker, and teamfighter, Nu is dangerous at all stages of the game. Possessing the strongest slow and Physical damage nuke in the game, Gravity Pulse, a damage augmenter with Micronebulae, numerous deadly floating mines with Antimatter Mines, and a powerful Ult, Warpstar, that can pull enemies in from thousands of units away and stun them, Nu is devastating if played correctly.
English.npc_dota_hero_lone_druid_hype: The Artificer is a man of means, and many means he has. Able to transform enemies or allies into statues with Reshape, purge off buffs with Naturalise, deal massive Magical damage on each attack with Unmaking, and create an illusory Replica of a target.
English.npc_dota_hero_chaos_knight_hype: Mindflayer, as the name implies, can destroy most casters. While his Ultimate, Vorpal Assault, may be strong, his real signature ability is his devastating Mana Seal, an area of effect spell that gradually drains the Mana of enemies standing in it. Should they reach zero Mana, they are mini-stunned, slowed, and take Magical damage, allowing him to continue his onslaught of stuns and Mana burning crits.
English.npc_dota_hero_necrolyte_hype: Strangely well-rounded, Erra is a nuker with access to his signature Grave Guard, an ability that activates when he drops below a portion of Health and restores his Health and Mana rapidly for a short time. Otherwise, he has access to a nuke that has a reduced cooldown and Pure damage, should any of the targets in the AoE be below 40% Health, bonus damage gained from the missing Health of nearby enemies, and a devastating close range nuke/damage over time with his Ultimate, Deathtouch.
English.npc_dota_hero_leshrac_hype: A master of late-game shenanigans, Ptolemy is a deadly scaling Intelligence core that can fire blades of light (Mirror Blade), convert Physical damage to Magical damage (Enthrall), force the target's soul out of their body (Astralise), and turn their Mana pool into a bomb (Expunge).
English.npc_dota_hero_ember_spirit_hype: A Tijadi Prince, nicknamed the Prince of Thunder, and so named for his control over electricity. Rai is a dangerous and excellently scaling nuker who is capable of destroying enemies when played well. A good balance of escape, initiation, control and damage output makes this Hero a deadly force on your team.
English.npc_dota_hero_riki_hype: Lupin is all about the surprise. With a kit that perfectly suits a roaming ganker, he is excellent against casters and squishy carries. Silence and slow your foes, Daze them, pop them with your trusty handgun, and then finish them with a one-two-slash-Ultimate.
English.npc_dota_hero_crystal_maiden_hype: The Shard Magus can command powerful ice magic with very little effort. Damage, slow, then stun your enemies with Cryst Whorl, blow them away with a barrage of icicles, and summon a powerful ice Wyrm to aid you in battle.
English.npc_dota_hero_sven_hype: A dangerous foe and valuable ally, the Demonfire Knight commands respect from his enemies in battle, with huge AoE stuns, a powerful attack steroid, and the ability to globally assist an ally for a short time.
English.dusk_hud_error_monolith_min_radius: Must be placed away from nearby Monoliths
English.dota_shop_spawn: The Dark Materials shop is now open for business!
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_example_ability_des: Detonator channels a charge and releases an explosion around the caster if the channel is successful, dealing damage and knocking back all enemies in range of the explosion
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ancient_passive_des: This structure gains bonuses and deals damage over time to nearby enemies.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ancient_defensive_w: Every 7s, the Ancient unleashes a pulse of devastating energy that instantly kills all creeps in a large radius, and deals Pure damage equal to 12% of all nearby enemy Heroes' Max Health. Only activates when under 33%% of its Max Health.
Deals the damage to each creep at random within a 2.5s interval when the timer hits zero.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ancient_last_resort: Upon dipping below 10%% health, as a final attempt to save itself, the Ancient resummons its dead Heroes and grants them invulnerability to damage, restoring their, and nearby other buildings', Health and Mana for a short time, within a large radius.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_tower_frenzy_descri: Upon dropping below 25%% health, the tower powers up its attacks, striking much faster and dealing 75 Magical splash damage for a short time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_titan_demolisher_De: Deals large bonus damage to buildings when striking them
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_cleanse_heal_amp_d: All healing amplified for this unit.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_divine_armour_bloc: Taking reduced damage for a short time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_paragon_cleanse_des: Heals an ally or deals damage to an enemy.  Additionally heals allies in a radius around them for a smaller amount.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_paragon_cleanse_Not: Secondary Heal does not affect the primary target.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_paragon_cleanse_Lor: The Paragon must learn to cleanse both his allies and his enemies of their worldly anchors.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_paragon_tranquility: The target is sealed, preventing them from dealing or receiving damage for the duration./nCan be cast on Buildings.
Sometimes the simplest of seals are the most effective.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_paragon_divine_armo: After reaching a threshold of damage, Paragon's Armour unleashes a blast of light, damaging nearby enemies based on their Maximum Health, and causing him to take less damage for a short time afterwards. Disabled by Break.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_paragon_smite_descr: The Paragon calls forth a divine bolt to strike the targeted enemy. Global./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_paragon_smite_aghan: Damage increase. Adds bonus damage if the target was the last person to kill a member of your team.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_paragon_smite_Lore: While the Paragon is pure in soul, retribution leaves a sweet taste on the tongue.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_paragon_guardian_de: The Paragon protects his nearby allies from harm for 5s, taking damage in their stead.  The damage is reduced.  Does not activate if Paragon himself is affected by Tranquility Seal.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_paragon_guardian_Lo: Protection and sacrifice are synonymous for the Paragon.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_paragon_conversion_: After a short delay, converts the target creep to Paragon's side. Creeps converted this way gain bonus attack speed, damage and movespeed. Converted creeps stay alive for a scaling duration. Only one converted creep is allowed at any one time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_crimson_life_drain_: Summons a sphere that, after a short delay, explodes, dealing Magical damage based on the missing health of affected targets.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_crimson_red_rituals: Pulls a portion of the soul from a target enemy, dealing damage and slowing.  Enemies hit by the traveling Soul Shard will take damage and be slowed as well.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_crimson_blood_sorce: Crimson calls upon the arts of his elders to trade his Mana for health, healing as much as possible, with great efficiency allowing the mana cost to be lower than the health healed.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_crimson_disintegrat: Crimson fires a beam of such incredible power that it melts through the defenses of its target, dealing current health percent based damage.  Reduces the target's Armor, Magic Resistance and Movespeed for a short time./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
If the main target is not a Hero, and Aghanim's Scepter is purchased, it will not jump to nearby enemies.
The beam jumps to nearby units with a short delay.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_elementalist_ice_bo: Fires a bolt of ice at the target, damaging them and slowing their attack and move speed.  Passively causes Elementalist's attacks to slow enemies.  Trinity causes Elementalist's attacks to slow enemies more based upon the level of this skill.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_elementalist_fire_b: Shoots a bolt of flame at the target, dealing large damage to them.  Passively increases Elementalist's damage.  Trinity causes Elementalist's attacks to deal bonus Magical damage based upon the level of this skill.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_elementalist_electr: Summons a bolt of electricity that deals damage over time to all targets within an AoE.  Passively increases Elementalist's attack speed.  Trinity increases Elementalist's attack speed based upon the level of this skill.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_elementalist_trinit: The Elementalist combines the powers of his spells, augmenting his attacks with them, but unable to cast them for the duration.  Each attack he makes is imbued with bonus magical damage based on the level of <font color='#ffcc56'>Fire Bolt</font>, a slow based on the level of <font color='#6699ff'>Ice Bolt</font>, and attack speed and damage over time based on the level of <font color='#66ffcc'>Electric Bolt</font>.  Lasts 15 seconds./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
Increases Strength, Agility and Intellect based on the level of Elementalist's Ultimate while it is active, and removes the casting restrictions.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_shade_dark_hunger_l: Shade feeds on his opponents' souls as they slip.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_shade_dark_hunger_d: Shade surrounds himself in dark energy, taking damage over time. While affected, he drains Health from nearby enemies, spreading the drain amount equally between all within the effective radius.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_shade_isolation_des: The Nightwalker causes the target enemy to emit a shockwave, dealing a small amount of damage, and petrifying all of their nearby allies for a short time. The main target has their total damage output reduced and is blinded.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_isolation_petrify_: Petrified and unable to help your allies at all.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_shade_stalk_lore: The venom that coats the blades of the Nightwalker can down giants with a single drop.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_shade_stalk_descrip: The target enemy is slowed and granted vision of, while Shade becomes invisible and moves faster. When attacking the enemy, he deals bonus Physical damage and applies a debuff that slows and deals Physical damage over time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_stalk_description: Stalking a target and dealing Pure bonus damage when attacking them.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_shade_shadowshift_d: Shade melds into the shadows, becoming Untargetable, moving %movespeed%%% faster and able to walk through units and terrain.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_shadowshift_descri: Untargetable, moving faster, and able to move through terrain and units.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_shade_venomous_desc: Shade applies a powerful Darkwyrm Venom that deals more damage the more debuffs the opponent is affected by. Deals %damage% damage per second per debuff.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_venomous_lua_descr: Taking damage over time and losing Armor.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_absolute_zero_Desc: Attack speed, move speed, turn rate and cast points are slowed. Nearby allies are being slowed slightly as well.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_absolute_zero_aura: Attack speed and move speed are slowed.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_lich_traveling_fros:
Fires a rolling wave of ice towards a target point. The first enemy it hits is damaged and frozen in place for a short time. Passes through and ignores units already affected by Traveling Frost.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
Increases hit detection radius, and Traveling Frost creates multiple projectiles that travel in random directions when it hits a unit.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_lich_winters_requie: All enemies within a large radius are marked. After a short delay, they are assailed by an icy explosion that deals damage and slows in an AoE.
Each explosion deals damage separately. If all explosions hit a target this Spell's damage total is 160/360/640/1000. With the Talent, it's 340/630/1000/1450.
This Spell cannot target a unit more than once.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_lich_deep_freeze_de: The Lich's attacks ignite a chain reaction of freezing magic in their target, causing them to become ministunned and take Magical damage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_lich_absolute_zero_: The target enemy is afflicted with a terrible curse, having their movespeed, attack speed and cast time for Spells drastically slowed for a long duration and slowing their nearby allies' movespeed and attack speed within a radius.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_snipe_caster_Descr: Gaining bonus attack range, damage, true strike, and vision of targets attacked for a number of attacks.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_hawkeye_ricochet_de: Fires multiple shots in succession at the target unit.  This ability preserves UAMs, attack effects, procs, and crits. Reduces the damage by a percentage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_hawkeye_ricochet_No: Issues an attack order on the targeted unit.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_hawkeye_snipe_Descr: Hawkeye focuses, gaining true strike, bonus attack range, bonus damage and vision of attacked targets for a number of attacks, but his movement slows to a crawl.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_hawkeye_snipe_Note0: The vision of attack targets lasts for 1.75s.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_hawkeye_detonator_d: Hawkeye pins an enemy with one of his powerful explosive devices.  After a short delay, the unit explodes, dealing large damage in a significant area.
If the unit dies, the explosion occurs regardless of the countdown.
Detonator Dart debuffs stack fully, unless the debuffs are being applied through Hawkeye's Talent, in which case it will not apply another debuff if one already exists on the unit.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_hawkeye_hit_n_run_d: With a spring in his step, Hawkeye leaps out of harms way using the explosive soles on his boots.  Leaves behind an area of damaging and slowing shrapnel to deter his more eager foes.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_hawkeye_double_tap_: After 1 second of charging, Hawkeye fires a projectile that travels a great distance, dealing base damage and damage based on a multiplier of his attack damage while piercing through enemies.  The first Hero enemy hit that isn't killed is marked for his second, more potent shot, which deals Pure damage.  After the shot collides with its targets, Hawkeye has a few moments to take the second shot./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
Increases range, shot speed, reduces Single Tap damage, but increases the damage of Double Tap.

Hawkeye fires a second shot, this time at the first enemy unfortunate enough to be hit by the initial shot.  Deals base damage plus bonus damage based on a multiplier of his attack damage, but hits a single target instead./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_extraplanar_pact_o: Currently out of game and recovering Health and Mana.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_voidal_flare_Descr: Being stunned for longer and taking more damage when hit by the next Voidal Flare.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_planar_trickery_De: A portal is active and ready to jump to.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_abyssal_shadow_Des: The Abyssal Shadow has been summoned to help you.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_void_strikes_burn_: The Abyssal Shadow's attacks grow in strength with each blow.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_gemini_voidal_flare: The Voidwalker fires a flare of dark energy at the target, dealing Magical damage and stunning them. The damage and duration increase by a flat amount each time it is used on the same target, up to a maximum amount of times.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_gemini_extraplanar_: Drags the target ally into another plane to make a pact with an extraplanar being, causing them to become invulnerable for a short time. Upon entering the pact, they recover a percentage of their maximum Health and Mana.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_gemini_planar_trick: Summons a portal beneath the target allied or enemy Hero's feet. At any time, he may recast this Spell to instantly transport to the portal's location, consuming it. If the Voidwalker dies, the portal disappears.
Teleports Voidwalker to a placed Planar Trickery portal on the map.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_gemini_abyssal_shad:
The Voidwalker summons a powerful being from another plane to help him fight. The creature floats behind him at all times and attacks anything nearby. Each level in this ability increases the creature's damage.
The creature's attacks deal bonus Magical damage that increases with each strike. It is invulnerable and untargetable.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_gemini_realm_bliste: Creates an area where reality has folded in upon itself, separating those inside from those outside. Units inside the hemisphere cannot damage or be damaged by outside targets.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_gemini_unstable_rif: Creates a portal at the Voidwalker's feet and another location on the map.  Any Hero, ally or enemy, that lingers on it for the delay time is instantly transported to the linked portal across the map. Those transported suffer 15%% of their maximum health as Magical damage. Silenced Heroes cannot use the portal, but will still count the delay time. The portal will only transport one unit at a time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_gemini_abyssal_vort: The Voidwalker unleashes his most powerful and dangerous spell, creating a gigantic vortex of whorling energy after a 1s delay.  The vortex drags in and damages all non-Magic Immune units, with the amount of damage dealt scaling as they get closer to the centre./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
Stuns enemy units that reach the centre.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_rend_Description: Taking %dMODIFIER_PROPERTY_INCOMING_DAMAGE_PERCENTAGE%%% more damage from all sources.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_bloodsport_Descrip: Taking damage over time for each stack.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_fury_terashock_desc: Fury slams the ground, dealing large damage and slowing nearby enemies. Empowers him for each unit hit, granting bonus attack speed.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_fury_rend_descripti: With each strike, Fury rends his target's flesh, reducing their maximum Health.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_fury_roar_Descripti: Fury unleashes a roar that leaves his enemies shaken and fearing for their lives. The sonic blast reduces their movespeed, damages them, and empowers Fury for each unit hit, granting him bonus attack speed, movespeed, and damage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_fury_bloodsport_des: The Deathbeast has such insatiable bloodlust that strikes against his opponents have an almost supernatural tendency to make them bleed.  Damages over time for each stack on the target.  Stacks last for 6s, and ignore damage block.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_fury_berserk_descri: With a frenzied roar, Fury lives up to his name, entering a state of frenzy, doubling the efficacy of all of his abilities. Increases his attack speed, causes Rend and Bloodsport to apply an additional stack, and doubles the damage, slow and bonuses if Roar is used while active.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_special_bonus_phant: Nightmare affects all enemies in the AoE on cast.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_nightmare_Descript: Unable to target the caster with Spells, Items or attacks.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_nightmare_caster_D: Units afflicted with the Nightmare debuff cannot target you with Spells, Items or attacks.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_shadowstep_delay_D: About to jump to your target Hero. Get ready!
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_phantom_shadowstep_: Phantasm weaves herself into the shadows, appearing behind a target enemy after a delay and gaining bonus movespeed and evasion. If she is stunned or Silenced during the delay, the Spell does not complete. Global.
As twisted a nightmare the Phantasm may be, she insists that it's nothin' personal, kid.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_phantom_nightmare_d: The Phantasm inflicts a terrible nightmare upon the target enemy. The nightmare prevents them from targeting Phantasm with Spells, Items, or attacks, and prevents the target from being targeted by their allies' Spells and Items.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_phantom_soul_wave_d: Emits a shockwave from Phantasm that deals Magical damage. She regains a portion of the damage dealt to all units as Health, after reductions and amplifications.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_phantom_deathstrike: The Phantasm's strikes are much more effective against targets close to death, dealing bonus Physical damage based upon their missing Health when below a threshold.
Her banishment from the material plane had some unintended side effects; such as the ability to strike directly at the soul of her targets.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_focus_Description: Gaining bonuses depending on what Stance we're in.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ironfist_hissatsu_d: The Monk goes invisible, moving with great speed, and damaging those around him.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ironfist_change_sta: Change between different Stances./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
The Lost One's training turns weakness to strength.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ironfist_focus_Desc: Ironfist focuses while he is not attacking or casting Spells, increasing the efficacy of his fighting abilities. Stacks of Focus grant different bonuses depending on the Stance he is in, and accumulate at a set rate. Casting a Spell will consume all stacks, whereas attacking will consume 1 stack, and prevent it from ticking up for a short time./nRegardless of what Stance he is in, casting a Spell will cause its cooldown to be reduced based on the amounts of Focus stacks he has./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ironfist_focus_agha: Increases the Focus stack maximum and reduces the interval.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ironfist_dragon_sta: Focuses on dealing damage and fighting prowess. Can counter attacks, and strike with extreme damage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ironfist_dragon_fis: Ironfist strikes the target with the fist of the Dragon, dealing massive Physical damage and stunning them.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ironfist_reversal_d: With some concentration it's possible to turn your opponent's strikes against them. Deals damage based on the attack's damage and stuns the attacker. If timed perfectly, deals more damage and stuns for longer.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ironfist_stonewall_: Focuses on withstanding attacks, and controlling enemies. Can stun and deal Magical damage, and displace enemy positions.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ironfist_quake_desc: Ironfist creates blasts of energy to fissure the ground beneath him, dealing damage multiple times.  Expands by the radius times the number of hits.  If 3 or more instances hit a target, they are stunned.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ironfist_boulder_th: Ironfist tosses the target enemy behind him. When they land, they are stunned and damaged.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ironfist_gale_stanc: Focuses on avoiding attacks, and moving quickly around opponents. Can slow enemies with a dash attack, and attack extremely fast for a short time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ironfist_lightning_: Ironfist strikes extremely fast for a number of attacks, reducing his BAT and increasing his attack speed.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ironfist_typhoon_de: Ironfist dashes forward, dealing damage and slowing those in his way.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ironfist_focus_red_: Places a focus on the target enemy, causing their weakpoint to be exposed.  Attacks targeting them will reduce their Strength and Armor.  If Ironfist hits a target with a red Focus, he will gain bonus damage for a short time./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
This ability goes on cooldown only when all three focii are cast.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ironfist_focus_gree: Places a focus on the target enemy, causing their weakpoint to be exposed.  Attacks targeting them will reduce their Agility and movespeed.  If Ironfist hits a target with a green Focus, he will gain bonus attack speed for a short time./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
This ability goes on cooldown only when all three focii are cast.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ironfist_focus_blue: Places a focus on the target enemy, causing their weakpoint to be exposed.  Attacks targeting them will reduce their Intelligence and burn their mana.  If Ironfist hits a target with a blue Focus, he will gain the mana burned as well./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
This ability goes on cooldown only when all three focii are cast.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_alchemist_alchemise: Transmutes the target enemy unit into gold, granting the Alchemist a large boost to his bank balance.  Passively grants gold per second.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_alchemist_bottle_th: The Alchemist consumes the next available consumable item in his inventory, throwing a flask at great distance towards the target enemy.  Depending on the item consumed, the flask has different effects when it lands./n/nEnhanced items have greater effects./n<font color='#6699ff'>TANGO:</font> Deals damage over time./n<font color='#6699ff'>HEALING SALVE:</font> Deals bonus damage./n<font color='#6699ff'>CLARITY:</font> Burns Mana./n<font color='#6699ff'>SMOKE OF DECEIT:</font> Blinds the target, causing them to miss attacks./n<font color='#6699ff'>DUST OF APPEARANCE:</font> Slows and grants true sight of the unit.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_alchemist_enhance_d: Enhances the first available consumable item in the Alchemist's inventory, turning it into a far more potent version of the original.  Sometimes, however, the item won't be quite what you expected...
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_alchemist_enhance_N: Can enhance Healing Salves, Clarities, Tangoes and Dust of Appearance.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_alchemist_motherloa: The Alchemist blesses a target ally with a strange magick, causing them to gain bonus gold from any units they kill based on the unit's bounty.  Denies also grant gold.
The unit still grants its normal bounty as well as the bonus gold.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_guardian_bubble_De: Stunned, but all damage heals you instead for a multiplier of the original damage (after reductions).
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_bladebreaker_Descr: Attacking will cause you to take damage and become disarmed for a short time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_elena_convoke_descr: Creates an area of effect that prevents health recovery and deals damage over time to enemies within it, stealing their Health and granting it to Elena herself. Has a 1s formation delay.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_elena_convoke_2_des: Deals damage to an enemy/heals an ally based upon Elena's Convoke stack total.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_elena_convoke_2_dam: DAMAGE OR HEAL PER CONVOKE STACK:
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_elena_devotion_desc: Grants bonus regeneration to nearby allies whenever Elena casts a Spell.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_elena_devotion_Lore: The protective aura of an Infuser grows stronger as their devotion to their subjects improves.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_elena_bladebreaker_: Elena enchants nearby opponent's weaponry with a powerful hex, causing them to take Pure damage equivalent to a base amount plus a portion of their attack damage, and become disarmed for a short time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_elena_guardian_bubb: Elena weaves a bubble of protective energy around the target ally, disabling them. The bubble converts damage taken to healing instead.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_elena_starlight_Des: After a short charge time, Elena fires a blast of energy in a line, damaging enemies and healing allies. The damage and heal increases for each enemy and ally Hero caught in it. The heal is only a portion of the damage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_elena_meditation_de: Elena channels, focusing on the target enemy. Her mental powers root them in place for a short time, then slow them for the rest of the channel duration. Grants vision of the unit.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_elena_meditation_Lo: Infusers are able to stay their enemy's hand through simple force of will.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_elena_diverge_descr: Elena channels for up to 12s, reducing damage to her allies in a 1000 radius.  As damage is dealt to her allies, the area fills with unbearable malevolent energies, dealing damage over time to all enemies within the radius based on the total damage accumulated.  If she would die during the effect, it deals 40% of the total damage pool to enemies.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_elena_diverge_Lore: Under the glowing enchantments of a skilled Infuser, the bloodlust of their enemies can be turned against them.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_elena_diverge_Note0: Ignores the reduction when calculating total damage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_elena_diverge_new_d: Elena creates an area that lasts for 16s, and deals damage over time. When damage is dealt to allies within the area, the damage over time grows in strength.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_elena_diverge_new_L: Under the glowing enchantments of a skilled Infuser, the bloodlust of their enemies can be turned against them.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_elena_diverge_new_N: Ignores the reduction when calculating total damage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_futurestrike_Descr: Taking damage after a random delay.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_haste_aura_effect_: Gaining movement speed, attack speed, and the chance to lower cooldowns upon spell cast.
The next spell cast will receive a reduced cooldown.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_dilation_Descripti: Turn rate, movespeed and attack speed are being slowed, while on-cooldown abilities are ticking up instead of down.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_timekeeper_dilation: Slows the targeted unit by shifting their position in the timeline. Their on-cooldown abilities will tick upwards instead of downwards.
The slow affects turn rate, attack speed and movement speed.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_timekeeper_chronosh: The Timekeeper knocks the worldline out of sync for a short time for a single unit.  When he reactivates the spell, the timeline resyncs after a short delay, returning the unit to the position, health and mana amounts they were at when this was cast.
After the delay this purges positive and negative buffs from all affected targets.
Ignores units that are not or were not alive when the ability was cast.
Ends the Chronoshift, returning the affected unit back to where they were, with the same Health and Mana as they had when Chronoshift was cast.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_timekeeper_futurest: After a random delay, deals Magical damage based on the length of the delay to the target enemy.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_timekeeper_haste_au: Timekeeper hastens his nearby allies, causing them to gain movespeed and attack speed. When a spell is cast, there is a small chance its cooldown will be reduced. Can be actively used on an ally to guarantee their next Spell will have a reduced cooldown, with double the effective cooldown reduction. Halved effect on Ultimate abilities.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_timekeeper_echo_des: Causes the target to echo recently taken damage, with a random chance.  The echoes diminish in strength as they continue.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_timekeeper_parallel: The Timekeeper temporarily drags a parallel of himself from a different timeline into existence, restoring his health and mana to full.  His stats return to what they originally were after the effect ends.  If he would die while under the effects of this spell, his respawn time is reduced.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_timekeeper_echoes_D: Creates an area where Timekeeper may cast his targetable abilities on any units within it, regardless of the distance. All abilities cast this way have an instant cast time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_timekeeper_chaos_wa: Stops time in a large radius around Timekeeper.  Allies and enemies affected by this ability are invulnerable for the duration.  Casting Dilation on a target will remove the time stop effect immediately, but not apply any other effects.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_bushido_Descriptio: Gaining bonus Agility and percentage bonus damage based on your Agility.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_mifune_genso_descri: Creates an illusion to attack the targeted enemy.  The illusions can be killed and move slightly faster than Mifune himself, but cannot be controlled.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_mifune_bushido_Desc: Mifune's intense training and discipline allows him to extract more benefits from his Agility. Upon activation, grants a percentage of his Base Agility as bonus Agility, and grants him bonus damage based upon his base damage for a short time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_mifune_bushido_agha: Bushido grants %scepter_evasion%%% evasion. When an enemy misses an attack against Mifune in this form, he instantly counterattacks.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_mifune_raigeki_desc: Slashes to create a burst of energy that travels at speed towards the target point.  After a delay, a second shockwave explodes across the battlefield, dealing the same damage.  Both attacks slow the enemy.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_mifune_zanmato_desc: Mifune focuses for a moment, then unleashes the most powerful ability in his arsenal; he slashes at blinding speed, attacking all enemies in the radius of the spell.  After this ends, the energy created from his attacks converges on the main target, dealing Magical damage for each enemy within the radius.  The main target is stunned while Mifune is slashing.  Deals bonus damage to Heroes./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_mifune_zanmato_Note: The main target is stunned for a minimum of 1s.
The slash preserves procs and orb effects.
The Orbs deal Magical damage, and converge on the main target when the initial slashes end.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_mifune_oiuchi_descr: Mifune strikes deathblows against low health enemies, dealing bonus damage based upon his Agility.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_mifune_oiuchi_Note0: Illusions created using Genso gain this ability, but deal 25% total damage with it.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_mifune_zanmato_scep: Mifune focuses for a moment, then unleashes the most powerful ability in his arsenal; he slashes at blinding speed, attacking all enemies in the radius of the spell.  After this ends, the energy created from his attacks converges on the main target, dealing Magical damage for each enemy within the radius.  The main target is stunned while Mifune is slashing.  Deals bonus damage to Heroes.
Increases cast range, damage, radius and reduces cooldown.
The main target is stunned for a minimum of 1s.
The slash preserves procs and orb effects.
The Orbs deal Magical damage, and converge on the main target when the initial slashes end.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_lightning_lightning: Lightning throws a dagger at the target enemy, dealing a small amount of Magical damage and slowing. The dagger bounces to a random nearby target a number of times before stopping.
The Tijadi have unending prowess with their throwing daggers, able to strike with pinpoint accuracy at the most elusive of foes.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_lightning_boltblast: Lightning summons forth a payload of electrical energy that detonates after a short delay, dealing damage and slowing enemies in an AoE.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_lightning_overload_: Slows and damages enemies in an area around Lightning.
Those who face the Tijadi in close combat rarely live long enough to see their full strength.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_lightning_spark_Des: Each time Lightning casts a spell, enemies in a large radius around her take Magical damage and are slowed by a small amount.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_lightning_spark_Lor: A Tijadi's fury can set the very air of the battlefield crackling and ready to destroy their foes.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_lightning_lightning: Lightning throws a dagger at the target enemy, dealing a small amount of Magical damage.
The Tijadi have unending prowess with their throwing daggers, able to strike with pinpoint accuracy at the most elusive of foes.
The initial slow is 100% and lasts for 0.75s.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_lightning_thunder_w: Creates a travelling cacophony of electrical blasts, slowing and damaging enemies hit by it.
While their preference is to fight face-to-face, magic is not beyond them.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_lightning_blinding_: Lightning moves at extremely high speeds through obstacles for 6s, dealing a small amount of damage and slowing when she charges through her enemies.  She takes no damage while under the effects of this spell, but will be still be affected by buffs and debuffs.  If she stops moving for 1s, the effect will end prematurely.
Drastically increases speed and purges debuffs over the duration.
Cumulatively grants Lightning bonus movespeed and attack speed as she uses her abilities.  When she hits max stacks, her BAT is reduced.
In tales, the Tijadi grow stronger and faster as the battle drags on.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_special_bonus_ourob: Nexus is Pure and Pierces Spell Immunity
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_diffusion_descript: Converting incoming Magical damage to Magic Resistance, Health Regen and Mana Regen.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_dualcast_Descripti: When toggled on, Spells are cast twice in quick succession.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ouroboros_searing_f: Ouroboros unleashes an incredible whorl of superheated gases from his vesicles, dealing damage to, and crippling for a very short time, enemies caught in the cone.
Increases slow and applies a stacking damage over time effect to targets hit.
Travels past the max cast range by 125 units.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ouroboros_nexus_des: Summons a devastating concentrated blast of flame from the sky after a short delay, dealing massive damage to enemies caught in the AoE.  Stuns for a short time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ouroboros_diffusion: As Ouroboros takes Magical damage, his scales diffuse its energies, converting it to life force. Increases Magic Resistance and Health and Mana regen based on the damage Ouroboros takes.
Damage below or between the threshold of 100 still increases Magic Resistance, Health regen and Mana regen, but does not show as a buff stack.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ouroboros_dualcast_: Ouroboros takes advantage of his extra appendage and spellcasting prowess combined, casting Spells twice in quick succession, provided he has the mana to do so. Consumes a multiplier of the original Mana cost of the Spell for the second cast.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ouroboros_dissipati: Passively grants magic resistance, dealing damage over time and reducing the magic resistance of nearby enemies.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ouroboros_dragons_w: Ouroboros takes flight, knocking back and slowing nearby enemies, gaining bonus movespeed and free pathing.  Lasts 7.5s.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_trickster_disappear: The targeted ally or enemy is temporarily removed from the game, reappearing at a random nearby spot after the duration.  Instantly kills non-Hero units.
A marker appears to show Trickster where the target will land.
Grants a 200 radius of vision around the landing point.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_trickster_encore_de: The targeted unit becomes cursed, unable to cast any abilities or use any items except for the last one they used.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_trickster_jam_magic: Creates an aura near Trickster that silences enemies that stray too close.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_trickster_surprise_: Fires a bolt of energy that deals large Magical damage, stuns, and disarms the target.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_tek_skycrack_descri: Tek unleashes a powerful beam of energy that cripples anyone caught in it, dealing large damage and slowing them.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_tek_skycrack_aghani: Reduces cooldown and causes Skycrack to burn Mana equal to a percentage of its damage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_tek_mosquito_missil: Tek locks on to as many targets as possible, then unleashes a barrage of laser missiles that deal small damage.  Can target units multiple times.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_tek_megaton_blast_D: Tek engages the kinetic generators in his suit. After a charge time, Tek fires a blast of pure force at the target, dealing large damage and ministunning them. The charge time is not a channel.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_tek_tesla_microarra: Deep within Tek's suit is a powerful electrical node. By redirecting his energies to it, he can cause it to release a blast of electrical coils that stun and damage nearby enemies. Deals double damage to enemies that are already stunned. Has a small charge up time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_tek_powered_skycrac: Tek unleashes a powerful beam of energy that cripples anyone caught in it, dealing large damage and slowing them.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_tek_power_power_up_: Tek Powers Up once more, causing a huge explosion that deals massive damage to nearby enemies and himself.  He is stunned for 2 second after using this ability.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_tek_power_up_descri: Tek Powers Up to make his abilities much stronger.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_tek_shield_descript: Tek creates a shielding bubble that absorbs a percentage of damage he takes.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_tek_powered_mosquit: Tek locks on to as many targets as possible, then unleashes a barrage of laser missiles that deal small damage.  Can target units multiple times.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_tek_powered_shield_: Tek creates a shielding bubble that absorbs a percentage of damage he takes.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_tek_aerial_assault_: Tek targets an area. After targeting for all possible missiles, or not targeting for 4s, he fires the missiles from his pack into the stratosphere. After a small delay time, they land on a target area, and after another small delay, they explode, dealing large Magical damage.
The missiles fire in succession initially in 0.3s intervals, with the interval reducing as more are fired.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_gaias_fury_Descrip: Next attack is dealing bonus damage based on Strength, dealing half and slowing in an AoE, and stunning the main target.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_ancient_arena_cast: Gaining various bonuses while in the Arena.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_reus_ancient_arena_: Reus summons an arena of stone to trap his enemies.  Units on the inside cannot exit, and units on the outside cannot enter.  Whilst within the Arena, Reus gains bonus move speed, attack speed, damage and armor.
For almost all cases, units that are spawned inside the arena are not removed from it.  This includes illusions, summoned units, temporary units, and heroes.

Invulnerable units can exit and enter the arena, but will immediately come under its effects when they are no longer in their invulnerable state.  Units that were invulnerable when the ability started are not considered to be trapped in the arena.
Has a maximum check range of 3000. If a unit goes beyond this range, they will not be pulled back into the arena.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_reus_magnitude_desc: Reus slams the ground to create an area that experiences deadly tremors, dealing damage and slowing enemies periodically.  Slows allies by 30%%.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_reus_gaias_fury_des: Reus charges his next attack with the power of the Earth. Upon striking a target, he deals bonus Physical damage based on his Strength stat, stuns them, and damages and slows all units in a large radius around them. Works on towers, but deals 0.25x damage, and stuns for half the duration.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_reus_stoneblast_des: The Titan goes to toss a heavy slab of rock towards his target location, dealing physical damage and stunning enemies caught in it.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_grapeshot_scepter_: Owner has a chance to Grapeshot a nearby enemy when attacking.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_lysander_adventurou: Lysander whips up a mystical wind that creates a wave, carrying him and enemy units caught in it forward a great distance. Leaves behind an area that slows enemies and speeds up allies.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_lysander_captains_c: Targets a unit with Lysander's Magical Compass, granting vision and truesight of them. Lysander gains bonus movespeed and attack speed based on how close he is to the unit.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_lysander_grapeshot_: Lysander fires his handgun at a target unit or building, dealing Physical damage based on his attack strength.  When shooting at short range, it ministuns the target.  Has a chance to crit, which halves the ability's cooldown, refunds the Mana cost, increases the damage, and ministuns regardless of how far away the target is./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
Lysander has a chance to Grapeshot a nearby enemy when he attacks. These shots can Crit as normal, but never stun.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_lysander_phantom_fl: Summons forth an ethereal ship that fires its chase cannons ahead, dealing damage to enemy units and buildings. Deals quarter damage to buildings.

Gives Lysander a guaranteed Grapeshot crit every 14s, doubles the stun duration, and autocasts Grapeshot on targets affected by Captain's Compass, if they are in range, but removes the crit chance completely.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_soul_claw_no_heali: Healing is prevented on this unit for a short time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_blood_rain_Descrip: Granting Lifesteal to enemies that attack you, and being slowed by %dMODIFIER_PROPERTY_MOVESPEED_BONUS_PERCENTAGE%%%.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_red_curse_Descript: Gradually losing Strength, attack damage and movespeed. At half its duration, this buff reaches its maximum power. Killing a unit will purge the buff.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_red_curse_caster_D: Gaining Strength as your enemy loses theirs.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_bloodwarrior_blood_: The Bloodwarrior consumes a portion of his own vitality to convert it into pure, unbridled rage, granting him incredible fighting prowess for a short time. He gains bonus movespeed, attackspeed, damage, and Lifesteal. Killing an enemy Hero under Blood Madness' effects will grant him bonus Lifesteal and add a bonus to the duration of the ability.

Global cast range. Bloodwarrior creates an area where blood rains from the skies, drenching enemies in sanguine fluid. The area damages enemies, and continuously applies a debuff that slows them and causes attacks to Lifesteal against them.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_bloodwarrior_red_cu: Bloodwarrior transfers his blood curse to the target enemy for a long duration. Steals Strength, slows, and reduces attack damage. The debuff gradually increases to its maximum strength, reaching 100%% of its reductions at half its duration. Killing a creep immediately dispels the debuff.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_bloodwarrior_soul_c: Occasionally, Bloodwarrior's strikes are imbued with his whorling vital energies, dealing bonus Magical damage, ministunning and preventing the target from regenerating Health for a short time. The bonus damage is based off his current Health.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_bloodfiend_dive_des: The Blood Fiend dives forth, gaining bonus movespeed and reducing incoming damage for a short time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_bloodfiend_feast_de: Feeds on the target unit, disabling it. Upon a successful channel, the unit is instantly killed, and a Revival stack is removed. When Revival stacks reach 0, the Bloodwarrior is revived.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_bloodwarrior_blood_: Vale's blood flows with the terrible curse of undeath. When he would die, he instead is transformed into a flying creature, called a Blood Fiend. The Blood Fiend has a ranged attack and flying movement, but lacks Health. If it feeds on 4 units with its Feast ability, the Bloodwarrior is revived where the Blood Fiend is, at 50%% of his Health and Mana./nThe Blood Fiend is disabled for 2s whilst Bloodwarrior is reviving, and reduces damage by 35%%./nIf the ability is on cooldown, it does not activate. The Bloodfiend automatically casts Dive when it spawns./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
Removes the cooldown requirement, increases the Blood Fiend's level by 2, and causes Bloodwarrior to be revived at 100% Health and Mana.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_bloodwarrior_grappl: The Bloodwarrior latches onto the target enemy unit/Hero, draining it of its blood, and rendering it immobile. Drains a percentage of the target's Max Health and Max Mana./n/nGrants the Bloodwarrior Health and Mana equal to 1.5x the amount drained./nMana drain is half that of the Health drain./nCreeps are drained for half the amount./nBloodmarked Heroes are drained for slightly more.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_bloodwarrior_red_ri: Burns the target enemy unit's blood, dealing Magical damage immediately, then damage over time. At the end of the DoT duration, the target is afflicted with a Bloodmark, causing the Bloodwarrior's attacks to Lifesteal 40%% from that target, and his spells to have increased power against them./n/nCasting Red Ritual on a Bloodmarked target will ministun them, and deal more damage./nBloodmarks last 12s.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_bloodwarrior_dance_: Bloodwarrior jumps to the target unit, dealing Magical damage./nIf the unit is marked, this ability deals more damage, and the cooldown is reset. The Bloodmark is consumed in the process.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_sanguine_hunter_blo: The Sanguine Hunter unleashes a powerful spell, cutting his health in half, but granting regenerative power or dealing non-lethal damage over time to the targeted ally or enemy, respectively.  The strength of this ability is based on a percentage of the health consumed.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_sanguine_hunter_lif: Links the lifeforce of the Hunter and another unit.  Whenever the unit deals damage, the Sanguine Hunter lifesteals a small percentage of it.  If the Sanguine Hunter receives damage, the affected unit gains life or takes damage based on the damage he took, depending on whether they're an ally or an enemy.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_sanguine_hunter_sad: The Sanguine Hunter revels in battle and blood, gaining damage and movement speed for each enemy Hero nearby that is below a health threshold, and lifestealing off units below the threshold.  Non-Hero units grant half the lifesteal bonus.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_sanguine_hunter_sou: The Hunter sacrifices his health over time, augmenting his next attack with huge bonus damage.  The attack causes him to regain health based on a percentage of the target's health.  Consumes up to 50%% of his maximum health.
Non-Hero units grant half the health bonus.
Buildings do not grant the health bonus.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_aether_disrupt_desc: Aether unleashes a blast of Rift energies, dealing damage and slowing enemies, and disjointing projectiles for all nearby allies.  Monoliths will cast this ability as well.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_aether_monolith_des:
Aether summons forth a Monolith that buffs allies and debuffs enemies, granting vision in a small area. Monoliths cast Disrupt when Aether does.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_aether_monolith_agh: Allows up to 3 Monoliths to be placed. They must be a minimum distance apart.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_aether_reality_shif: Aether drags all nearby units from this plane to the next temporarily, returning after the duration ends, and damaging and stunning enemy units within range that were not affected by the initial cast.  Units affected are out of game and invulnerable for the duration.
Has a delay time of 0.2s, but an instant cast time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_aether_teleport_des: The targeted allied unit is teleported to Aether's position after a short delay.  Aether can target herself to teleport to her Monolith, but the delay time is doubled.  A silenced unit will not be transported.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_aether_teleport_Not: Teleports the unit to the position Aether was in when the spell was cast, not when the spell ends.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_sands_of_war_attac: Sands of War Attack Speed Talent
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_sirocco_aura_ally_: Set and his controlled Puppets are gaining Health over time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_sirocco_aura_enemy: Taking damage over time and vision is being reduced.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_scarab_curse_displ: Taking damage over time equal to the damage stolen on initial cast.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_scarab_curse_damag: Your damage is feeding the Scarab!
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_set_duststorm_descr: Set creates a whorl of sand that slows and damages enemies caught within it.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_set_harsh_sun_descr: The very presence of the Sand God turns the climate during the day from gentle to harsh, reducing enemies' attack speed and vision globally. Meanwhile Set is empowered by this harsh weather, gaining bonus movespeed and vision. Is less effective on creeps.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_set_harsh_sun_Note0: Does not affect Ancients or Magic Immune enemies.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_set_sands_of_war_de: Set kicks up two sand clouds that travel quickly and pass through each other.  Enemies hit by them are slowed. When they reach their destination, two Sand Puppets are spawned.  Sand Archers have large attack range that scales with level but low damage, and Sand Warriors have short attack range but high damage plus bonus movespeed that scales with level, and both last %time% seconds.  Sand Puppets are based upon Set's level, not the level of this skill.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_set_scarab_curse_De: Set places a curse on the target unit, summoning a Scarab to fly around them. The Scarab steals a portion of their attack damage, and then deals damage every %interval% second based on the amount stolen plus a base damage amount. Set can retarget the debuff to any other nearby unit within a %retarget_range% radius with his Switch Scarab Targets subability.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_set_sirocco_Descrip: Set unleashes a merciless sandstorm in the area around him. Enemies caught in it take %damage% damage per second, and have their vision reduced to %vision_change%, while Set and any Sand Puppets under his control recover Health equal to the damage amount. Lasts %duration% seconds. %radius% radius. Deals damage in 0.25s intervals. The vision reduction fully affects Buildings (but the damage does not).
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_set_an_army_beneath: Set channels, becoming invisible and creating a vortex of sand that slows and damages enemies, periodically summoning Sand Puppets to do his bidding.  The Sand Puppets will attack any enemies that are caught within, and will immediately die upon exiting the area or when the spell ends.  Sand Puppets generated through this ability are a multiplier of Set's level./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
Lowers the interval, increases damage over time, increases slow, Sand Puppets can leave the area without dying.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_set_sand_puppet_arc: This creature is a Sand Puppet of the Archer variety.  Has a large attack range and medium movement speed.  Its attack range increases as its level does.
