English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_set_sand_puppet_war: This creature is a Sand Puppet of the Warrior variety.  Has a small attack range and medium movement speed, but deals high damage, slows enemy movement speed and gains bonus movespeed passively.  The slow and movespeed bonus increases as its level does.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_neith_decisive_stri: Neith strikes a devastating blow with bloodlust alone against a random nearby enemy, dealing large Magical damage, slowing their attack speed and movespeed, and stealing some of their Armor for a short duration.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_neith_inspire_descr: The Warrior Goddess' actions inspire her comrades, increasing their attack damage for a short time when she uses her abilities near them. Grants less damage to creeps.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_neith_monsoon_descr: Neith unleashes an attack that cripples nearby enemies and empowers her, dealing damage in an AoE and stealing attack damage, alongside reducing their Armor.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_neith_rally_descrip: With a war cry, Neith rallies her nearby allies to battle, increasing their attack damage, move speed and attack speed for a very short time. Creeps gain less attack damage, but the same amount of move speed and attack speed./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_neith_rally_aghanim: Increases radius and duration, and reduces nearby enemies' attackspeed, movespeed and damage by the same amount as it increases for your allies.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_ancestral_recall_d: Gaining bonus stats equal to a number of levels on your Hero.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_chains_of_fate_des: Taking damage when nearby units take damage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_fate_displace_descr: Displaces the target ally's destiny temporarily, making them untargetable, attack immune, not appear on the minimap, and move through units. Disjoints projectiles and purges debuffs upon cast.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_fate_ancestral_reca: Fate channels, targeting an ally. When the channel completes, he grants them access to greater knowledge of their past and future. Grants them bonus stats as if they were a number of levels higher than they currently are, and restores their Health and Mana by a percentage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_fate_doomsayer_desc: Fate places a deathly curse on the target area. After a delay, the area implodes, dealing damage based on the Max Health of all affected Heroes inside it. Displaced units have the buff purged immediately off them./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_fate_doomsayer_agha: Reduces the Max Health of the affected targets by 15%% for 5s.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_fate_realign_descri: Realigns allies and enemies in a small AoE, dealing damage to enemies and healing allies.  Immediately ends Displace's first effect.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_fate_chains_of_fate: Fate binds the targeted unit with the chains of fate. Any unit bound to the chains will receive a portion of the damage units in the radius receive.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_special_bonus_baham: Desolation's AoE ticks each apply 1 stack of Fulmination to all affected targets.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_desolation_descrip: Taking (and dealing to nearby allies) damage over time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_desolation_Descrip: Taking damage over time and dealing it to allies in an AoE.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_bahamut_desolation_: Forces elemental energies into the target enemy, dealing Magical damage and surrounding them with a burning aura that deals damage over time to nearby enemies. The main target has any Fulmination stacks it possesses detonated.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_bahamut_fulmination: Each attack that Bahamut makes against his enemies begins to pull apart the strands of reality, reweaving them into explosive energies.  A short time after he stops attacking them, these energies detonate, dealing large damage based on the amount of stacks accumulated. The final detonation damage is equivalent to the number of stacks multiplied by the base damage, and is increased by a percentage per stack.
The bonus damage is linear. 8 stacks grants a 100% damage bonus.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_bahamut_mega_flare_: Summons an orb of pure power that slowly travels towards the targeted point, detonating when it reaches it to deal massive Pure damage.  Enemies closer to the center of the explosion take more damage.  Has a minimum cast range.
The minimum cast range is 475.  Targeting a point below this range will force the targeted point to be 475 units away from the caster, in the direction they cast it.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_bahamut_reckoning_a: Bahamut's very presence causes nearby enemies to take more damage. Can be targeted on an enemy to double the effect for them alone.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_horror_terrify_des: Will run away from Horror when he draws near.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_paranoia_Descripti: Taking damage every second for each nearby allied unit and Hero.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_sinister_slow_Desc: Slowed and granting your vision to Horror.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_horror_alone_descri: Shrouds an area near Horror to be shrouded in darkness, causing enemies to lose all vision for a short time. When Horror is unseen by the opposing team, passively grants him bonus movespeed, and allows him to exceed the movespeed cap. The effect lingers after entering vision for a short time. If his Ultimate is active, he gains the bonus regardless of whether he can be seen or not.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_horror_deathmark_de: Applies a deathmark to a target enemy.  When Horror next attacks them, a slow and bonus damage will occur, and they will not be able to cast spells.  Grows in power the longer the deathmark remains on the target before being activated.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_horror_shadowclone_: Summons an illusion that deals large damage to enemies and moves faster than Horror himself.  Upon expiration, all damage dealt by the illusion is reverted.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_horror_terrify_desc: Using dark magic Horror instils a deep fear in the target enemy. For a short time, they are slowed slightly. If Horror draws near, they take damage, the slow becomes more powerful, and they can do nothing but run away.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_horror_terrify_Note: Horror's illusions do not cause terrified units to run away.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_horror_obscure_Desc: Creates a blast of darkness around Horror that deals damage, then applies a blind, reducing affected units' vision range to 0, and causing them to miss all of their attacks.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_horror_paranoia_Des: The targeted enemy is cursed to take damage for each of their nearby allies over time. Creeps deal less damage than Heroes. Deals a base amount of half the Hero damage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_horror_sinister_Des: Horror gains vision of the target enemy, bonus movespeed, and Flying movement. Every strike Horror makes against that enemy while this effect is active is a critical attack, and each time he strikes the critical damage increases.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_heroic_soul_bonus_: Gaining bonus damage and move speed after purging negative effects.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_hero_freedom_strike: For freedom!  Hero leaps into the air, and upon landing, deals damage and slows enemies in a short radius.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_hero_heroic_soul_de: For courage! Hero unleashes a war cry that removes any negative effects he's experiencing and grants him bonus damage and move speed for a short time.  Can be cast while stunned.  The first 0.75s of the effect reduces the damage he takes by 60%%.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_hero_justice_kick_d: For justice! Hero kicks the target enemy, knocking them back a short distance and slowing them.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_hero_one_punch_desc: Hero unleashes a devastating punch that deals critical damage, launching the enemy into the air. After a short delay time, they land, creating an explosion that deals Magical damage and stuns any affected units.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_hero_one_punch_agha: Increases crit and increases the Magical damage upon landing by a multiple of Hero's attack damage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_hero_hyper_kick: Ultimate Saviour of the Downtrodden Hyper Justice Kick!
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_hero_hyper_kick_des: For justice!  Hero kicks the target enemy, obliterating literally everything instantly.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_chronos_continuum_c: Envelops the target unit in temporally suspended crystals, rendering them invulnerable and disabled for the duration, while recovering a percentage of their health and mana.  Volatile temporal energy leaks from the crystal, dealing damage and slowing in an AoE around them.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_chronos_future_sigh: Chronos casts a spell that allows him and his allies to see into the future, giving them a chance to completely avoid damage sources.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_chronos_sync_descri: Beneath Chronos' feet lies the Timepiece, a powerful fundamental that dictates his form.  When it is red (tick), he gains bonus damage and attack speed.  When it is blue (tock), he gains bonus Armor, Magic Resistance and movespeed.  Each phase lasts 60s.  Casting this ability immediately switches over the phase.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_chronos_warp_descri: Chronos teleports himself to the location targeted, dealing damage, and afflicting enemies with a powerful slow, on his departure and arrival points.  After a short while, he returns to the location he originally cast this ability from, dealing damage and slowing at both points once more.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_st_anchor_Descript: Being pulled back to the centre of the anchor radius when leaving it.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_spatial_rift_displ: Can jump to a Rift with Port Out.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_superposition_desc: Currently occupying the space between dimensions.  Taking no Physical damage and unable to be perceived by enemies.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_baal_axial_seal_des: Baal seals a target allied or enemy unit away, killing them instantly and creating an Axial Seal.  Axial Seals can attack enemies.  Each level in this ability causes them to grow stronger.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_baal_otherworld_des: Baal enters a parallel dimension, unable to be detected by enemies, becoming immune to Physical damage and attacks but taking bonus Magical damage.  He is still able to cast spells, and gains bonus movespeed, but cannot attack or use any items.  Can be cancelled at any time during use.  When Baal is stunned or silenced whilst in the Otherworld, he is kicked out of it immediately.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_baal_superposition_: Baal creates an area where he is able to instantly occupy any location within it, then teleports.  Enemies within the area are slowed.  Increases his attack speed and attack range whilst within the area.  Issuing move orders within the radius will instantly transport him to that location instead of making him walk there.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_baal_vector_plate_d: Summons a plate facing away from Baal.  Enemies and allies that step on the plate will be rooted and pushed in the direction the arrow is facing.  Enemies take damage and are slowed by this.  When cast, a sub ability allows you to change the direction the arrow is facing with a second cast.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_baal_vector_plate_c: Changes the direction of the last Vector Plate you created to face the cursor position.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_baal_vector_plate_s: Prevents Baal from being affected by his own Vector Plates when toggled on.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_baal_compress_descr: Compresses the target unit, turning them into a carriable orb.  The orb can be thrown by casting Fire, and deals damage in an AoE upon landing.  If Baal does not throw the orb before the timer reaches zero, it explodes, damaging him and stunning him.  Lasts 3.5s max.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_baal_fire_descripti: Fires the orb at the target area.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_baal_compression_sp: Creates an area in which Baal's allies can move freely, but his enemies are slowed the longer they remain within it. Applies a stacking slow to turnrate, movespeed and attackspeed over its duration. The slow is unique to the unit within it, and leaving the sphere will reset the stacks.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_baal_spatial_rift_d: After a 1 second channel time, creates a rift at the target location that deals damage and slows drastically.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_baal_st_anchor_desc: Anchors the target enemy to a location.  When they move too far away from the location, they are stunned, take damage, and are teleported to it.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_baal_superposition2: Baal enters a state of instability for a short time, becoming untargetable, invisible, unrevealable and immune to Physical damage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_solwave_descriptio: Dealing damage over time to nearby enemies and yourself.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_shatter_descriptio: Slowed and Magic Resistance is reduced by a sizeable amount.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_alroth_energy_burst: Creates a blast of energy that deals large damage to nearby enemies, as Alroth takes half the damage he dealt.
Prevents Alroth's health from dropping below 1 for 0.2s.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_alroth_raze_descrip: Alroth creates an unstable maelstrom that deals damage over time to units caught within it.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_alroth_raze_Note0: Deals damage immediately on cast, then every second thereafter until it finishes.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_alroth_shatter_desc: Alroth's strikes break through the enemy's defenses, causing them to lose Magic Resistance and take bonus Magical damage based upon his attack damage.  Enemies hit by this will lose Mana equal to double the damage taken.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_alroth_solcharge_de: Gathering the energies of the Planes, Alroth surrounds himself with a sphere of pure devastation, flying with speed at the targeted enemy.  Upon arrival, he deals large Magical damage in an AoE and stuns units caught in the centre of the explosion.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_alroth_solcharge_No: Has a minimum travel time of 0.5s.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_alroth_solwave_desc: Gathering the energies of the Planes, Alroth surrounds himself with an aura of pure devastation, dealing massive damage over time to nearby enemies. Lasts 4s.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_special_bonus_alexa: Deals the damage instantly in the effective radius.
Restores the same percentage as it does for Alexander, but halved, and in the effective range.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_elandras_blessing_: Receiving bonus damage and Armor, and dealing damage based on your main Attribute when attacked.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_godfall_descriptio: The next attack made will deal Pure damage as a bonus.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_radiant_descriptio: Recovering a percentage of your Health over time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_alexander_godfall_d: Unleashing the true power of the Godslayer, after a short channeling Duration, the next attack Alexander makes deals bonus Pure damage as a percentage of his attack damage, healing him for the damage dealt if the target was a Hero. This skill purges positive buffs from the enemy. Deals 5x damage to illusions./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_alexander_godfall_a: Reduces cooldown, and Godfall applies Soulseal to all enemies within a 325 radius when the attack lands.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_alexander_radiant_d: Alexander is bathed in an unearthly light, a magick used oft by Paladins.  Causes opponents to miss attacks, as he rapidly recovers health over time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_alexander_soulseal_: Seals away the target's soul with the power of the Godslayer to slow, prevent them from casting spells, and break their passives for a short time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_alexander_elandras_: Blesses the target ally with bonus attack damage and Armor. When they are struck by an enemy, the attacker takes Magical damage based on the blessed ally's main Attribute.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_alexander_steadfast: Alexander gains bonus damage and Armor based on the amount of Health he has. The more Health, the larger the bonuses.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_odin_gods_eye_descr: Odin leers over a target area, granting vision and slowing, and damaging, silencing, rooting and muting invisible units.  Instantly kills illusions that wander into the radius.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_odin_gungnir_descri: Odin throws his spear at a target location globally.  After a 2s delay, the spear lands with destructive impact, dealing large Magical damage to all those unfortunate enough to be caught in the blast, and stunning them.  For a short while afterwards, Odin's attacks are far weaker and shorter range, until his spear returns to his person./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_odin_gungnir_aghani: Increases damage and removes attack range and damage debuff.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_odin_oppression_des: With each of their strikes against Odin, his opponents despair, losing attack damage and attack speed.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_odin_sleipnirs_veil: Sleipnir whinnies and drags itself and its master into a veiled plane, rendering them invisible to enemies and granting them bonus movespeed.  Enemies that are passed through take damage and are slowed.  Can pass through enemies multiple times.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_astaroth_deathmark: On the 5th strike, losing a percentage of current Health and being stunned.
Gaining True Strike and %dMODIFIER_PROPERTY_ATTACKSPEED_BONUS_CONSTANT% bonus attack speed, plus bonus Pure damage on attacks.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_astaroth_pain_curs: Taking bonus damage and being slowed when damage is taken.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_astaroth_deathmark_: Upon striking an opponent a number of times, he removes a portion of their Health and stuns them, gaining bonus attack speed and Pure damage on his attacks for a short time afterwards. While this ability is on cooldown, he cannot increment marks on any target.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_astaroth_erase_desc: Astaroth calls upon Abyssal energies to slowly erase the target's existence, dealing damage to Health and Current Health, and Mana and Current Mana, over a large duration.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_astaroth_overwhelm_: Astaroth forces energies into the target unit.  After 2s, the unit creates an explosion that deals large Magical damage to itself and the units around it.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_astaroth_pain_curse: Afflicts the target unit with a curse that lowers their pain threshold. Causes them to be slowed for a short time, and take bonus damage, whenever they are affected by a damage instance. Has an internal cooldown on the slow.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_astaroth_pain_trans: Puts a curse on the target unit, causing them to be slowed every time they take damage. The slow has an internal cooldown.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_flux_field_aura_De: Taking damage and being ministunned when any unit in the radius casts Spells or uses items.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_micronebula_displa: A portion of damage taken will be dealt over time after duration ends.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_nu_flux_field_Descr: Nu gathers the fluctuating energies of the cosmos into one spot, creating an area that deals damage over time. Whenever an enemy casts a Spell or uses an item that costs Mana whilst inside the area, all enemy units in the radius are damaged and ministunned.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_nu_gravity_pulse_De: Nu creates a devastating gravitational pulse at the target area, dealing large Physical damage and slowing drastically any enemies caught in it.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_nu_micronebula_Desc: Nu summons a Micronebula that latches onto the target unit. At the end of its duration, a percentage of damage the unit took is dealt over 3s to units in a 325 radius before dissipating. Reduces Armor. If the target would die, half the damage they would have taken at the end of the duration is instead dealt instantly to all units in the radius.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_nu_warpstar_Descrip: A devastating cosmological entity, the Warpstar, after a short delay, deals Pure damage and transports allies and enemies alike to the position where Nu cast the spell. During the delay, enemies caught in the vortex are slowed.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_nu_warpstar_Note0: Allies do not take damage from this ability.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_nu_warpstar_Note1: Transport targets are locked 0.4s before the ability completes. Even if those locked targets leave the immediate area, they will be transported.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_special_bonus_mana_: The Silence occurs when it's placed and is independent of the duration of the Mana Seal.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_mana_seal_cooldown: Prevented from being affected by Mana Seal's 0 Mana effects.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_mana_knight_arcanum: The Mindflayer's attacks have a chance to strike at the soul of his targets, shattering their Magical energies. Removes Mana from the target, and deals bonus Magical damage, alongside reducing all outgoing spell damage for a short time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_mana_knight_infusio: Mindflayer fires a bolt at the target that stuns them, and deals damage based on their missing Mana.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_mana_knight_mana_se: The Mindflayer creates a glyph that seals away Magical energies, gradually draining the Mana of enemies that stand upon it. If their Mana hits 0, they are mini-stunned, damaged and slowed for 1.5s. Ignores targets affected by the 0 Mana mini-stun for a short time afterwards.
Upgrades Mana Seal to pierce Magic Immunity, increases the mana drain per second, reduces the ignore time to 4s, and makes the damage upon reaching zero Mana Pure.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_mana_knight_vorpal_: The Mindflayer unleashes a flurry of anti-Magic energy at the target, dealing damage, burning Mana, and cumulatively Silencing them. Each bolt applies its effects separately, and is not a projectile; it hits instantly. There is a short delay between the bolts.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_artificer_naturalis: The Artificer temporarily reduces the target's form to their natural state, causing them to lose all bonus Armor and Magic Resistance from abilities and items, and a flat amount of attack damage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_artificer_replica_D: The Artificer moulds a near-perfect replica of the target ally or enemy. Creates an illusion copy of the target ally or enemy Hero, but it cannot cast spells or use items./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_artificer_replica_a: Causes enemies killed by Artificer to spawn weaker Replicas automatically.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_artificer_reshape_D: Summoning voidal energies to do his bidding, the Artificer quickly transmogrifies the target enemy into an immobile statue. The statue takes half damage from everything.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_artificer_unmaking_: The Artificer lobs Nothingness at the target enemy, eating away at their very existence. Deals bonus Magical damage and then Magical damage over time based upon the target's Current Health.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_special_bonus_gob_s: Gob Squad rides his rocket into battle.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_gob_squad_clearance: The Gob Squad offloads all of their excess explosives, throwing a bomb out of their cart every half second. Bombs deal Magical damage, Physical damage and slow, or Pure damage and stun, and land in a random location nearby. The Gob Squad takes half damage from the bombs./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
Reduces interval between bombs, releases a giant bomb upon duration end or death.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_gob_squad_kamikaze_: Charges for 4s, gaining bonus movespeed. When the duration ends, or the Gob Squad dies, they explode, losing a portion of their Health (based off their maximum Health), and dealing Magical base damage plus bonus damage based on the amount of Health they lost. They are stunned for 1s after use.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_gob_squad_rocket_bl: Fires a rocket at the target location. Upon colliding with any enemy units or buildings, the rocket will explode, dealing Magical damage in an AoE. Explodes when colliding with buildings, but deals no damage to them.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_gob_squad_whoops_De: When Gob Squad dies, they immediately explode, dealing heavy Magical damage in a large area around them and stunning affected enemies for a short time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_techies_focused_det: The Gob Squad offloads all of their excess explosives, throwing a bomb out of their cart every half second. Bombs deal Magical damage and land in a random location nearby. The Gob Squad takes half damage from the bombs.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_techies_land_mines_: Fires a rocket at the target location. Upon colliding with any enemy units or buildings, the rocket will explode, dealing Magical damage in an AoE. Deals 0.25x damage to buildings
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_techies_stasis_trap: Charges for 4s, gaining bonus movespeed. When the duration ends, or the Gob Squad dies, they explode, losing a portion of their Health (based off their maximum Health), and dealing Magical base damage plus bonus damage based on the amount of Health they lost. They are stunned for 1s after use.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_techies_suicide_Des: When Gob Squad dies, they immediately explode, dealing heavy Magical damage in a large area around them.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_special_bonus_erra_: When allies drop below the threshold, they gain the Grave Guard buff as if they possessed the skill. Has its own cooldown.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_erra_grave_guard_r: Gaining bonus Health and Mana regen over time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_to_dust_show_Descr: Granted bonus attack damage based on missing Health of nearby enemies when cast.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_erra_deathtouch_Des: With but a touch, Erra rends the target's soul asunder, dealing massive damage over time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_erra_grave_guard_De: When Erra drops below certain threshold of Health, he gains bonus Health and Mana regeneration for a short time to combat it.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_erra_morbid_blade_D: Summons forth the winds of the Black Tide to slice through all enemies caught in them. Deals Physical damage, but if any enemy is below a Health threshold, it deals Pure damage, and its cooldown is halved. A portion of the target's missing Health is granted as healing to Erra.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_erra_to_dust_Descri: Revelling in the pain of his enemies, Erra drinks in their dwindling lifeforce, converting the entropy to damage. Grants bonus attack damage based on the amount of missing Health of all the enemies in the radius given.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_special_bonus_war_1: 40% of the healing you gain from enemy attacks during FIGHT ME!! is also restored as Mana.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_berserker_aura_fx_: Gaining bonus attack speed and attack damage based on missing Health.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_bloodlust_Descript: Gaining bonus attack damage and attack speed, and taking damage over time while not attacking. Each attack reduces the amount of ticks of damage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_fight_me_Descripti: Forced to attack War. He regains Health from damage you deal to him, and Bloodlust does not tick down.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_fight_me_regen_Des: Gaining Health from affected units' damaging abilities or attacks, then dealing Magical damage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_war_berserker_aura_: Grants bonus attack damage and attack speed to nearby allies based on their missing Health.
The damage bonus lingers for 2s after leaving the aura radius.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_war_bloodlust_Descr: Causes enemies in an area to gain bonus attack speed and attack damage, but have their movement speed slowed and take damage over time for a large duration. Each attack they make reduces the amount of time the debuff stays on them.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_war_earthbreaker_De: War slams the ground with his axe, stunning nearby enemies and dealing Physical damage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_war_fight_me_Descri: War goads his enemies into striking him. Each attack an affected enemy makes against War causes him to regain Health instead of losing it. At the end of the duration, he deals Pure damage equal to a portion of the combined attack damage of all enemies affected and his own attack damage. Bloodlust does not tick down for affected units. Affected enemies do not take damage from any source during the duration of this ability.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_war_fight_me_Note0: Any damage dealt to War by the affected enemies recovers his Health, regardless of whether its source was an attack or not.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_war_fight_me_Note1: If War dies, the effect ends early.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_astralise_Descript: Stunned, taking no Magical damage, and healing/damaging in an AoE based on Intelligence.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_enthrall_Descripti: Converting all Physical damage to Magical damage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ptomely_astralise_D: The targeted unit has its soul removed from its body, dealing damage to enemies, and emitting pulses that heal allies and damage enemies. Deals damage based on a percentage of the target's Intelligence. Heals for half the amount.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ptomely_astralise_N: There is a 0.5s delay before pulses start.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ptomely_enthrall_De: The targeted unit is afflicted with a powerful enchantment that lowers their Magic Resistance and converts all Physical damage taken to Magical damage before reductions. If the Physical damage would be negated absolutely (such as if the unit is Ethereal, or with Phantasm's Shadowstep), the effect does not function.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ptomely_expunge_Des: Drains a base amount plus a portion of current Mana out of the target unit, slowing them and creating an orb of energy above them. After a short delay, the orb explodes, dealing Magical damage equivalent to the amount drained, and restoring Mana to nearby allies equal to half of the amount drained. The damage cannot go below a minimum amount./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ptomely_expunge_agh: Causes the spell to drain a percentage of the target's Max Mana as well as their Current Mana.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ptomely_mirror_blad: Fires multiple blades of pure energy towards the target location, dealing Physical damage based upon Ptomely's Intelligence.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_thunder_roar_Descr: Striking nearby targets with bolts of lightning.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_static_blade_Descr: When toggled on, dealing bonus damage and slowing on the next attack based on the amount of stacks accumulated.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_static_blade_slow_: Being slowed and taking damage over time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_amplify_Descriptio: Dealing damage over time to nearby enemies, then zapping some random targets.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_rai_amplify_Descrip: Rai forces his electrical energies into the air around him, causing it to damage nearby enemies over time. At the end of the duration, bolts of lightning zap multiple randomly selected nearby targets, slowing and damaging them.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_rai_arc_twister_Des: Rai travels to a target location at extreme speed, arriving after a very short delay, and dealing damage to any enemies caught between his start and end point.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_rai_static_blade_De: As Rai deals Magical damage over a threshold to enemies, he gains Static Blade charges. When toggled on, deals bonus Magical damage, slows, and damages over time the enemy struck based on the amount of charges he has.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_rai_thunder_roar_De: After a short cast time, Rai creates an area of high energetic potential that follows him, striking a random nearby enemy with a bolt of lightning every few moments. The bolts mini-stun enemies and deal half damage in a large area around them.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_lupin_beneath_the_m: Lupin's next attack against a Hero deals bonus Physical damage, Silencing them and stealing their movespeed and attack speed.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_lupin_finisher_Desc: Lupin fires a shot from his trusty pistol at the target, dealing Physical damage. If the target is Stunned or Dazed, deals bonus damage and Lupin makes an attack against them. Slows for a short time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_lupin_flashbang_Des: In an area of effect, Lupin causes enemies to become Dazed by throwing a Flashbang. Dazed enemies are stunned, but the effect is removed if they take damage from any source.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_lupin_flashbang_Not: Enemies stay Dazed for a minimum of 0.5s.
The damage source needs to exceed 20 to purge the Daze.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_lupin_last_surprise: Lupin quickly strikes all enemy units in a line with an attack, then does the same in the opposite direction, arriving at his starting location. Creeps take less damage from this skill.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_special_bonus_shard: Glacial Impact Hits Buildings (2x Stun, 0.5x Damage)
Against non-building targets, it does the same amount of stun and damage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_iceheart_slow_Desc: Slowing turnrate, movespeed and attack speed.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_cryst_whorl_Descri: Being slowed, then stunned, and taking damage over time through the whole duration.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_frostfall_Descript: Losing a portion of your current HP over time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_shard_magus_cryst_w: The Shard Magus unleashes a blast of chilling magic at the target location. Enemies caught in it take a small amount of damage, and are afflicted with multiple phases of debuffs. Every few seconds, they take damage, and proceed to the next phase. The 1st is a grace period, the 2nd slows, and the 3rd stuns.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_shard_magus_icehear: Whenever the Shard Magus casts a spell, her ensorced heart reacts, surging an icy shockwave forth. The shockwave deals damage, and slows movespeed, attackspeed and turnrate.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_shard_magus_icicle_:
With an incantation lost to time, the Shard Magus summons a turret-like structure before her. After a short delay, the turret begins peppering the area in front of it with myriad icicles. Each icicle deals damage and fully pierces the target.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_shard_magus_glacial: The Shard Magus creates shards of ice that burst through the ground, stunning and damaging any enemies caught inside the radius.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_shard_magus_wyrm_ri: An ancient spell brings forth a Wyrm; a powerful and dangerous dragon from a time long past. The Wyrm has access to the spell Glacial Impact, and is surrounded by chilling winds. Its attack deal damage over time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ice_wyrm_frostfall_: The Ice Wyrm is surrounded by chilling air, slowly chipping away at her enemies' fortitude. Deals damage over time based on the affected units current HP.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ice_wyrm_glacial_im: After a short delay, cold winds converge on the area, chilling it to freezing near instantly, and creating a large icy structure. Deals damage and stuns any affected units.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_ice_wyrm_winters_br: The Ice Wyrm's attacks are ensorced with icy power, dealing damage in an AoE and damage over time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_upwind_root_Descri: You're floating in the air... cannot move!
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_aerial_ace_slow_De: Attacked by an airborne Aeronaut, alas!
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_air_raid_Descripti: Attacking random enemies in a large radius.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_aeronaut_upwind_Des: The Aeronaut creates a blast of air that knocks him and nearby enemies upwards, leaving them floating for a short time. Enemies affected take Pure damage, and while they are floating, they are Rooted. Meanwhile, the Aeronaut gains Flying movement and bonus attack range for a long duration.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_aeronaut_dashy_dash: The Aeronaut dashes forward. Any unit hit by him during the dash takes Pure damage, is mini-stunned, and stops the dash. The dash will only hit units on the same elevation as the user.
In his early days, the Aeronaut delegated the naming of his techniques to an ancient being, who, in his blocky, colourful and gravity-filled wisdom, named one Dashy Dashy.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_aeronaut_aerial_ace: Gundalar's fighting prowess increases when he is airborne, granting him bonus movespeed and attack speed. Additionally, when striking grounded units while Flying, he deals bonus damage and slows them for a short time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_aeronaut_air_raid_D: Gundalar fires attacks at random enemies within a large radius. The attacks fully preserve UAMs and procs, and deal full damage. If he is stunned or disarmed, the attacks will not fire.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_aeronaut_land_Descr: Immediately land if flying due to Upwind.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_special_bonus_siegf: Applies on creating a new buff, not on refreshing an existing one.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_eon_shield_slow_De: Turn rate, movement speed and attack speed are slowed.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_hell_bent_Descript: Being forced to attack the target you chose, but taking less Physical damage and gaining movement speed and attack speed.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_epochs_protection_: Magic Immune for a short time after casting a Spell.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_heaven_sent_caster: Returning to the cast location when this expires.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_siegfried_eon_shiel: Siegfried tosses his ancient shield in the target direction, dealing %proj_damage% damage to enemies hit on the way. When it arrives, after a %delay% second delay, it deals %area_damage% and roots enemies in it for %root% seconds.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_siegfried_hell_bent: Siegfried sacrifices %health_reduction%%% of his current Health to use the Demonfire forged into his soul and enter a frenzy, forcing himself to attack the target enemy for a short time. He gains bonus attack speed and bonus movespeed, alongside taking %damage_reduction%%% reduced Physical damage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_siegfried_epochs_pr: When Siegfried casts a Spell, Epoch grants him a shard of his protective energies, blessing him with Magic Immunity for a short time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_siegfried_heaven_se: Siegfried appears at the location of the target ally, rendering them invulnerable and untargetable, but unable to perform actions. After %duration% seconds, he returns to the location he cast the Spell from. Globally targetable./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
Drastically increases Siegfried and his ally's Health Regen for the duration.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_special_bonus_balth: +350 Ward of the Emerald Flame Range
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_emerald_fang_Descr: Taking damage over time based on the user's attack damage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_ward_of_the_emeral: Taking damage over time and being revealed and slowed drastically if invisible.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_balthasar_firebolt_: Balthasar unleashes a blast of jade fire at his target, dealing damage and then damage over time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_balthasar_doomflame: With a howl, the Wolf summons a wave of fire that washes over the battlefield, leaving damaging ground in its wake. Balthasar may traverse this ground at extremely high speed, catching enemies that normally would escape him.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_balthasar_emerald_f: Striking his enemies with a deadly fang, Balthasar deals Magical damage over time to enemies based on his attack damage. Ticks every 0.5s.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_balthasar_ward_of_t: Summons the Ward of the Emerald Flame to guard an area, granting Flying vision, dealing damage over time, and slowing enemies by a small amount. Any invisible unit that wanders under the Ward is revealed and receives the full slow amount.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_example_item_d: Gives the caster a 50% damage reduction for 4 seconds while firing a projectile that deals damage 125 PURE damage to any enemy it hits.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_eloras_music_b:
Active: Song of Silence

Creates a %radius% area around the caster that persists for %duration% seconds. Any unit, friend or foe, that enters this area, is Silenced until they leave it, or the effect ends.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_eloras_locket_:
Active: Cursed Image

Summons an illusory image of the target enemy that lasts %duration% seconds. Deals %illusion_outgoing_damage%%% damage and takes %illusion_incoming_damage%%% damage. The illusion deals %bonus_magical_damage% bonus Magical damage when striking the Hero that they are a copy of.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_improved_wand_:
Passive: Redirection

When an enemy casts a spell within %range% units, this item gains a charge. Max %max_charges% charges./n/n

Active: Restoration

Using the Wand consumes all charges within it, restoring %restore_per_charge% Health and Mana per charge, and %percent_per_charge%%% of their Max Health and Mana per charge, to the target ally.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_waveshield_des:
Active: Greater Warding

Applies a shield to the target ally that blocks an attack and knocks back the attacker %distance% units, stunning them for %stun_duration% seconds. The buff lasts up to %duration% seconds.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_seers_lantern_:
Active: Farsight

For %duration% seconds, in a %radius% radius, all enemies and allies become Ethereal, taking %magic_res_reduction%%% more Magical damage, slowing enemies by %slow%%%. Invisible enemies affected are revealed, and the slow is 4x stronger against them. The true sight lingers for a short time after the effect ends.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_wand_of_yggdra:
Active: Greater Drain

Drains %hp_drain% Health %hp_percent_drain%%% of the max Health %mp_drain% Mana, and %mp_percent_drain%%% of the max Mana, of the target enemy. After a %delay% second delay, you regain the amount drained as Health and Mana.
The drain deals Pure damage, and is not blocked by Spell Immunity.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_black_rose_des:
Active: Rending Darkness

After a %active_delay% second delay, the target enemy takes %damage% Pure damage, both the caster and the target are stunned for %active_duration% seconds and take %active_damage_increase%%% bonus damage from all sources while stunned. If either target is more than %max_distance% units away when the delay ends, nothing happens. Both the debuff and the stun cannot be purged.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_black_rose_Not: The debuff cannot be applied to the same target during the delay time or the stun duration.
If either unit is not alive at the moment the delay time completes, the effect does not occur.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_black_rose_lor: Its name refers not to the vibrant colour of the flower, but the accursed energies that swirl within.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_hephaestus_ham:
Active: Guardian Wall

Surrounds all structures within %aura_radius% units with a protective wall of energy, reducing their incoming damage by %active_damage_reduction%%%, granting %active_regen_bonus% bonus Health regen, and causing enemies that attack those structures to be afflicted with a %active_move_slow%%% movement slow and %active_att_slow% attack slow for %active_slow_duration% seconds./n/n

Passive: Reinforce

Grants %aura_armor_bonus% Armor to nearby structures within a %aura_radius% radius.
Forged of a benevolent master, it glows dimly with a blue light. Its core, embedded in the hammer's hilt, threatens blinding, sunlike properties, but remains a calm yellow.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_hephaestus_guard_D: Reducing damage taken by %dMODIFIER_PROPERTY_INCOMING_DAMAGE_PERCENTAGE%%% and gaining %dMODIFIER_PROPERTY_HEALTH_REGEN_CONSTANT% Health regen.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_deathscythe_De:
Passive: Soulclaimer

Attacks the wielder makes against Heroes purge buffs, slow by %slow%%% for %slow_duration% seconds, remove %percent_damage%%% of their current Health, and place this item on cooldown. The removal cannot be reduced, amplified or blocked.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_deathscythe_lo: Studied for eons, the Deathscythe's soul bending properties have perplexed even the most learned of scholars.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_crystal_focus_:
Active: Prismancy

Grants a charge of Prismancy to the caster. Upon casting a non-Ultimate Spell, the charge is consumed, the Spell is refreshed, and you lose %mana_percentage%%% of your current Mana.

A crystalline flower, found growing in the tombs of powerful mages. It is said to increase the caster's ability to channel magical energy greatly, but its absorptive properties can render a mage's Mana pool rather empty after use.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_crystal_focus_pris: The next non-Ultimate Spell you cast will have its cooldown refreshed, and you'll lose a percentage of your current Mana.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_soul_vial_desc:
Passive: Soul Collection

Grants bonus damage for each charge, gaining a charge each time a unit is killed. Heroes grant 8 charges instead./n/n

Active: Consume

Devour the souls in the Vial to regain Health over time and bonus damage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_soul_vial_lore: An ancient relic, first lauded by the Artificers for its swirling etheria, but quickly forbidden upon discovery of its macabre secrets.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_grim_gauntlet_:
Active (Heroes): Unleash

When targeting a Hero, consumes all stored charges to deal %damage% damage and slow them by %slow%%% per charge stored in the item. The slow duration increases as charges increase./n/n

Active (Creeps): Capture

Imprisons the soul of the target creep, devouring it soon after, restoring %health_perc%%% of the creep's current Health as Health and %mana_perc%%% as Mana. Adds a charge to the item. Maximum %maxcharge% charges.
Deals 2/5ths of the damage in the first instance after a 0.75s delay, then the last 3 instances over 0.75s.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_purging_dust_D:
Active: Purge

Purges the user's debuffs as a strong dispel. Does not purge stuns.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_purging_dust_l: A rare commodity, the sparkling powder of the Nullstone removes all traces of magical energy from whatever it touches, quickly vanishing after its job is complete.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_arcanite_shard:
Passive: Arcanite Induction

When a single instance of Magical damage from the user would exceed %minimum_dmg%, consumes a charge and deals %bonus_dmg% bonus Magical damage to the target.
The volatile properties of Arcanite deter most sorcerors from its use, but for those who care not for a few lost limbs, it is a valuable ally.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_ironblood_poti:
Active: Drink

Grants %bonus_armor% Armor and %bonus_magic_resistance%%% Magic Resistance for %buff_duration% seconds.
An ancient goblin salve for wounds. Side effects may include: difficulty breathing, increased heartrate, magnetic eyebrows.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_item_ironblood_pot: Grants bonus Armor and Magic Resistance for a short time.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_rage_potion_De:
Active: Drink

Grants %bonus_damage% bonus attack damage and %bonus_attack_speed% attack speed for %buff_duration% seconds.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_ability_item_rage_potion_Lo: When the Goblin Army of Toothslicer approached the Tijadi's crackling abode, many fled. Some died. Those that drank this solution fought harder, but fell all the same.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_item_rage_potion_D: Grants bonus attack speed and attack damage for 6s.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_frenzy_description: This tower will become more dangerous for a short time when it dips too low on health.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_frenzy_bonus_effec: Gaining bonus attack speed and splash damage.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_last_resort_invuln: Unable to take damage, recovering Health and Mana rapidly.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_defensive_wave_des: Fires devastating beams at creeps and Heroes every 4s.
English.DOTA_Tooltip_modifier_compression_sphere: Being affected by a %dMODIFIER_PROPERTY_MOVESPEED_BONUS_PERCENTAGE%%% movement slow %dMODIFIER_PROPERTY_ATTACKSPEED_BONUS_CONSTANT% attack speed slow, and %dMODIFIER_PROPERTY_TURN_RATE_PERCENTAGE%%% turnrate slow.

tooltips.name: Aether
tooltips.hype: A support with a set of skills designed to save allies and annoy enemies, Aether can drag an ally out of a bad situation with Teleport, deal damage and disjoint projectiles with Disrupt, place buffing Monoliths with Monolith, and suck all enemies and allies in the immediate area into a dimensional safe zone.

tooltips.name: Alexander
tooltips.hype: A servant of her Radiance, former paladin and wielder of the legendary Godfall, Alexander is a tanky and difficult to deal with carry that can buff allies, Break and Silence enemies, heal himself and demolish those who would dare stand against him with his Ultimate.

tooltips.name: Alroth
tooltips.hype: A commander of fire and ash, the being known as Alroth brings a great deal to the table when it comes to Magical damage. Boasting an array of abilities like the area of effect damage over time Maelstrom, instant cast Health draining explosion Energy Burst, Magic Resistance breaking Shatter, and powerful close range DoT Solwave, Alroth is capable of dealing with enemies his way, and no one else's.

tooltips.name: Astaroth
tooltips.hype: A late game carry, Astaroth's job is to hit you five times with his Black Insignia to deal his damage. What he lacks in sturdiness he more than makes up for in spells, with access to a slow that activates upon the target taking damage (Pain Curse), that transforms the target into a walking bomb (Overwhelm), and a devastating Ultimate that does its best to erase their existence (Erase).

tooltips.name: Baal
tooltips.bio: A being from a forgotten Plane, the creature known only as 'Baal' foresaw that which his kind did not; the End. In his dreams he saw fire descending upon his people, destroying all that he knew. His fears came to a head, and with the help of others, he put a plan in motion; before the cataclysmic event, he would drag his world into the next Plane, and deal with the consequences afterwards. The event began as his dream foretold: a being of light and fire had formed, infantile and oblivious, its light singeing the edges of his home. With a cry, he and his comrades used all of their might to push their home through the warping walls of the Plane. All seemed well, until the gap widened, and an unfathomable force tore at the Plane. His home began to crumble as it fell through, and he watched with horror as the being of fire was torn from its celestial cradle, its form washing over and searing all that he knew to ash. As he fell into this new plane, his anger and guilt consumed him, his physical form a self imposed prison for his transgressions against his own kind.
tooltips.hype: A positional manipulator as masterful as they are irritating, Baal's job is to constantly keep the enemy on their toes. Create a sphere that gradually slows enemies' attack and movement speed, anchor them to the ground with Spatiotemporal Anchor, teleport to a location after channelling with Spatial Rift, and enter a state of uncertainty to wreak havoc on your unsuspecting enemies with Superposition.

tooltips.name: Bahamut
tooltips.hype: Possessing a good balance of Physical and Magical damage, Bahamut is a powerful mid-game Agility carry. Turn your enemies into a walking radiance with Desolation, increase the damage they take with Reckoning Aura, deal ever increasing Magical damage with Fulmination, and finish the fight with the obliterating Mega Flare.

tooltips.name: Balthasar
tooltips.bio: The ancient tribes of Iyat, once spanning the sundered plains, passed down many tales. One of which was that of the Great One, an elder of elders, their whim bending reality around them, their heart a roaring flame. It is said that their son grew jealous of such power, and wished to gain it for himself. Whenever asked, the Great One only spake: 'in due time.'As the son's jealousy grew, he devised a plan. Using the essence of envy, he forged a weapon: a blade of emerald fury, with the power to extract the abilities of the Great One. One night, he snuck into the Great One's keep, and went to strike him down with his blade. However, the Great One was prepared; he had seen his son forging this monstrosity. As the son landed the final blow, the Great One uttered a curse, sealing his soul into the sword itself. The son could not extract the powers, no matter how hard he tried. Defeated by his failures, he took his own life using that same blade. Yet death did not come easily to him; instead, the Emerald Blade and the Flame of the Great One combined, creating a jade flame. The son's form dissipated, and he was transformed into a creature of the night, a protector of the fire: The Wolf of the Emerald Flame.

tooltips.name: Bloodwarrior
tooltips.hype: A difficult to kill right-clicker with a wide subset of abilities. Able to shower enemies in blood to grant Lifesteal to his allies, slow and steal Strength from targets, strike with his vital force, and ingest his own blood to enter a maddened state for a short time.

tooltips.name: Elena
tooltips.bio: There is an old folktale the Tijadi pass down, of a mother and her young child. The child could speak to Spirits, but should they utter a word in return, they would be wrenched of their immortality, left weak and vulnerable. The Marqas, arbiters of order, deemed her child cursed, and banished her to the Nothing. As the darkness twisted around her, pulling every cell from her body for an agonising eternity, the true nature of her curse was discovered. The spirits of the old land began to die, one by one, their souls fading as the child's did. In a panicked realisation of their mistakes, the Marqas pulled her from her prison and tasked her with wandering the planes and restoring the dead or mortal Spirits, bestowing upon her incredible powers of regeneration and fighting prowess.
tooltips.hype: The healer in chief, Elena is an excellent sustainer with incredible teamfight capabilities. Possessing damaging/healing AoEs and an Ultimate that turns the opponents' attacks against them, she is difficult to deal with in any case.

tooltips.name: Erra
tooltips.hype: Strangely well-rounded, Erra is a nuker with access to his signature Grave Guard, an ability that activates when he drops below a portion of Health and restores his Health and Mana rapidly for a short time. Otherwise, he has access to a nuke that has a reduced cooldown and Pure damage, should any of the targets in the AoE be below 40% Health, bonus damage gained from the missing Health of nearby enemies, and a devastating close range nuke/damage over time with his Ultimate, Deathtouch.

tooltips.name: Fate
tooltips.hype: Fate is an extremely difficult but highly rewarding character to use. Frail and slow, but possessing a multitude of devastating spells that can function as both support or offensive abilities, Fate can destroy most enemies given enough space in a fight. Wrap your opponents in chains that bond their destinies together, dealing damage as nearby units take damage, reduce the damage your allies take with Displace, heal and damage in an AoE with Realign, and grant you, or an ally, the stat power of extra levels, with Ancestral Recall.

tooltips.name: Fury
tooltips.hype: A scary bear. Difficult to run from once he gets a few hits off, Fury is a powerful ganker and carry due to his incredible Bloodsport and Rend abilities, a damage over time per hit and max health reduction per hit, respectively. His Q is Roar, empowering him for each unit hit in its AoE for bonus attack speed, movespeed and damage, and his Ultimate makes him attack even faster and augments the power of his Rend and Bloodsport. A true force of nature.

tooltips.name: Voidwalker
tooltips.hype: Eccentric, perhaps, but undoubtably skilled, the Voidwalker can crush opposition with a set of dangerous abilities, including a purging bolt of pure energies, a portal that can transport allies to anywhere on the map, a pact with a being from beyond, and a terrifying vortex of abyssal energies that pulls enemies into the centre with ease.

tooltips.name: Gob Squad
tooltips.hype: The meaning of madness, Gob Squad cares not for self-preservation, only for destruction. Firing long range rockets with Rocket Blast is where the sanity ends-- the rest of their skillset is dangerous for everyone. Become extremely fast, then explode, with Kamikaze. Throw numerous bombs out of your cart with their Ultimate, Clearance Sale, and of course... explode anyway on death, with Whoops!!

tooltips.name: Hawkeye
tooltips.hype: A sharpshooter with a focus on dangerous equipment, Hawkeye matches his explosive madness with equally explosive abilities. Double Tap is a great mid-range nuke, and he has access to powerful escape in the form of Hit 'n' Run. His Ultimate, Detonator Dart, is a devastating delayed nuke that also stuns.

tooltips.name: Hero
tooltips.hype: Fast and furious, Hero is a get-in-get-out Hero with a fun to use skillset. Kick your enemies away with Justice Kick to set up for your pouncing Freedom Strike, break out of stuns and purgable disables with Heroic Soul, and obliterate your targets with the famed ONE PUNCH!!

tooltips.name: Horror
tooltips.hype: Horror is a dangerous ganker, capable of forcing enemies to run away from him with Terrify, blind them with Obscure, cause them to isolate themselves from their allies with Paranoia, and teleport to anyone he can see with Sinister.

tooltips.name: Ironfist
tooltips.bio: White, pockmarked knuckles gripped the wooden frame. A glint in the dark; eyes darting to and fro, surveying their surroundings carefully for any sign of movement. A moment later, the figure slipped into the shadows of the room, the door closing gently behind him. Many had come to seek the Lost One, to destroy him and the twisted reality he represented. This man, however, was different. He sought more than simple destruction. He wished to learn the Lost One's ways, and become powerful. So was born the Ironfist; master of every method of fighting.
tooltips.hype: Master of many arts, Ironfist is a powerful adversary. Equipped with three sets of skills that he can switch between, and three modes: tank, high damage or speed, Ironfist is capable of adapting to most situations very quickly.

tooltips.name: The Lich
tooltips.hype: A progenitor of frost magic, The Lich freezes his foes with reckless abandon, crushing them with powerful long range disables, close range nukes, a devastating Aura, and a global chill that slows enemies drastically.

tooltips.name: Lightning
tooltips.hype: A nuker with an emphasis on spammable abilities, Lightning is a quickfire Hero that allows very little to stand in her way. Crush your enemies with short range, extremely low cooldown nukes with Lightning Daggers, a powerful, long range and explosive blast of lightning in Boltblast, a pulse of slowing electrical energy with Overload, and augment all of the above with her Spark, dealing damage whenever she casts them.

tooltips.name: Lupin
tooltips.hype: Lupin is all about the surprise. With a kit that perfectly suits a roaming ganker, he is excellent against casters and squishy carries. Silence and slow your foes, Daze them, pop them with your trusty handgun, and then finish them with a one-two-slash-Ultimate.

tooltips.name: Lysander
tooltips.hype: This cap'n is all about disrupting his enemies. His long range Physical nuke, Grapeshot, makes him great at consistently damaging enemies. Captain's Compass grants him bonus movespeed whilst moving towards his enemies, whilst Adventurous Gale allows him to charge forth and carry enemies with him. Should he be in trouble, he can summon the great Dreadnaught, a ghostly ship that fires numerous cannonballs ahead of it.

tooltips.name: Mindflayer
tooltips.hype: Mindflayer, as the name implies, can destroy most casters. While his Ultimate, Vorpal Assault, may be strong, his real signature ability is his devastating Mana Seal, an area of effect spell that gradually drains the Mana of enemies standing in it. Should they reach zero Mana, they are mini-stunned, slowed, and take Magical damage, allowing him to continue his onslaught of stuns and Mana burning crits.

tooltips.name: Mifune
tooltips.hype: A powerful master swordsman, hailing from the land of spirits, Mifune has access to an array of extraordinary abilities, one of which being the devastating Zanmato, a strike that deals more damage to the target the more units are around them.

tooltips.name: Neith
tooltips.hype: A pusher and teamfighter, Neith's capabilities are devastating in the first 20 minutes of the game. Steal your opponents' attack damage with Monsoon, crush them solo with Decisive Strike, increase your allies' attack damage with Inspire, and Rally your creeps and Heroes to take tower after tower!

tooltips.name: Nu
tooltips.hype: A disabler, nuker, and teamfighter, Nu is dangerous at all stages of the game. Possessing the strongest slow and Physical damage nuke in the game, Gravity Pulse, a damage augmenter with Micronebulae, numerous deadly floating mines with Antimatter Mines, and a powerful Ult, Warpstar, that can pull enemies in from thousands of units away and stun them, Nu is devastating if played correctly.

tooltips.name: Ouroboros
tooltips.hype: A sturdy and dependable nuker, Ouroboros is tanky and destructive, capable of disrupting fights and single handedly taking down most enemies, should they be struck by his slow moving skills. Possessing fire breath in the form of Searing Fire, a powerful stun in Nexus, scales that convert Magical damage he takes to Spell Amp and attack damage, and a devastating Ultimate that causes his Spells to be cast twice in quick succession.

tooltips.name: Paragon
tooltips.hype: A healer of mind and body, and a destroyer of his enemies, Paragon can entirely negate damage with his Tranquil Seal, staunchly defend himself with Divine Armour, heal his allies or damage his enemies with Cleanse, and inflict massive amounts of Pure damage globally with Smite.

tooltips.name: Phantasm
tooltips.hype: A spectral form that can barely be perceived, Phantasm may be fragile, but she is an incredibly powerful manfighter and late game carry. Possessing a cleave that increases its damage the more times it hits, an excellent scaling AoE nuke/slow that is based on her Attribute total, a devastating critical strike that deals more damage the lower Health the target is on, and a long range teleport that allows her to quickly close the distance against even the most elusive foes, Phantasm is a powerful and terrifying Hero.

tooltips.name: Ptolemy
tooltips.hype: A master of late-game shenanigans, Ptolemy is a deadly scaling Intelligence core that can fire blades of light (Mirror Blade), convert Physical damage to Magical damage (Enthrall), force the target's soul out of their body (Astralise), and turn their Mana pool into a bomb (Expunge).

tooltips.name: Rai
tooltips.hype: A Tijadi Prince, nicknamed the Prince of Thunder, and so named for his control over electricity. Rai is a dangerous and excellently scaling nuker who is capable of destroying enemies when played well. A good balance of escape, initiation, control and damage output makes this Hero a deadly force on your team.

tooltips.name: Reus
tooltips.hype: Not many Heroes can claim to have as much visceral impact with their abilities as Reus. Rending the earth itself asunder, Reus may fire stunning rocks with Stoneblast, create slowing and damaging tremors with Magnitude, wallop enemies into next week with Gaia's Fury, and trap his enemies and allies in an arena that is impossible to escape-- buffing himself in the process-- with Ancient Arena.

tooltips.name: Set
tooltips.hype: A sieger and teamfighter, Set functions best in messy fights where he will not be interrupted whilst channelling his devastating An Army Beneath the Sands. Focused on creating powerful Sand Puppets through his Sands of War and Ultimate, he can quickly push down towers if not kept in check. His Harsh Sun passive grants him bonus regeneration and slows enemies' attack speed during the day, globally.

tooltips.name: Shade
tooltips.bio: Few possess a reputation capable of striking fear into the Arca of the realm, but the Nightwalker was one. A veteran assassin, and a slayer of countless mages, he tore across Lochraith at the drop of a coin, seemingly unstoppable. Not all lives were his, however; a young Arca had seen him coming days in advance, and set a devious trap. Caught in a powerful binding spell, he prepared to take his last breath, but the Arca hesitated. For all the trouble he had caused, all those he had killed in the name of avarice, he deserved worse than death. His punishment would forever be wandering a dark void, unable to escape, with no need for material goods, with no quarries to find. She hastily weaved a dark, terrible curse, full of isolation and solitude. But curses are fickle creatures, born of terrible, turbulent emotions. She realised her mistake all but a second too late. Using the very threads she had weaved prior, the Nightwalker tore her from the plane, imprisoning her in a desolate realm, using his undying connection with her to weave dark magic of his own.
tooltips.hype: Shade is a powerful Agility Hero that relies on his enemies being isolated to deal his damage. His blades are coated in Darkwyrm Venom, dealing damage based on the amount of debuffs his opponent has. He can Stalk a target to inflict a large amount of Physical damage and slow, and he can sustain in fights with his terrifying Dark Hunger. His Ultimate, Isolation, may remove an enemy from their allies, crippling their ability to deal damage.

tooltips.name: Shard Magus
tooltips.hype: The Shard Magus can command powerful ice magic with very little effort. Damage, slow, then stun your enemies with Cryst Whorl, blow them away with a barrage of icicles, and summon a powerful ice Wyrm to aid you in battle.

tooltips.name: Vulcan [NT][NC]
tooltips.hype: The sieger of towers, destroyer of bases, and overall one of the most annoying Heroes to play against, Vulcan is a defensive core that can place nests of units all over the map. His Tesla Coils are weak on their own, but in groups they are devastatingly powerful, and the Sentinel can down towers in a short time. His Vassal, built with an innate ability, can help him kill enemies with its wide set of powerful spells, but is fragile and slow.

tooltips.name: Tek
tooltips.hype: An extremely dangerous nuker, Tek can crush most opposition with a great deal of Magical damage very quickly. His Skycrack is a low cooldown nuke+slow, Mosquito Missiles deals a huge amount of damage spread between available targets, Quantum Vibrance Engine causes his attacks to become more dangerous as he builds up charges from using his abilities, and his Ultimate is a powerful uninterruptable AoE stun.

tooltips.name: Timekeeperer
tooltips.hype: Keeper of timelines, the Timekeeper is difficult to use but rewarding when used correctly. Able to deal random damage after a random delay, slow enemies drastically, have a chance to reduce his and his allies' cooldowns, and save/load an ally's position, Health and Mana, Timekeeper is a powerful and dependable support.

tooltips.name: War
tooltips.hype: A tank with access to a powerful stun in Earthbreaker and damage over time with Bloodlust, War is a dangerous Hero to play against. He is difficult to kill, and his Ultimate, Fight Me!, makes him even more disruptive, turning his opponent's damage against them.

tooltips.name: Aerial Ace
tooltips.Description: Gundalar's fighting prowess increases when he is airborne, granting him bonus movespeed and attack speed. Additionally, when striking grounded units while Flying, he deals bonus damage and slows them for a short time.

tooltips.name: Air Raid
tooltips.Description: Gundalar fires attacks at random enemies within a large radius. The attacks fully preserve UAMs and procs, and deal full damage. If he is stunned or disarmed, the attacks will not fire.

tooltips.name: Dashy Dashy
tooltips.Description: The Aeronaut dashes forward. Any unit hit by him during the dash takes Pure damage, is mini-stunned, and stops the dash. The dash will only hit units on the same elevation as the user.
tooltips.Lore: In his early days, the Aeronaut delegated the naming of his techniques to an ancient being, who, in his blocky, colourful and gravity-filled wisdom, named one Dashy Dashy.

tooltips.name: Land
tooltips.Description: Immediately land if flying due to Upwind.

tooltips.name: Upwind
tooltips.Description: The Aeronaut creates a blast of air that knocks him and nearby enemies upwards, leaving them floating for a short time. Enemies affected take Pure damage, and while they are floating, they are Rooted. Meanwhile, the Aeronaut gains Flying movement and bonus attack range for a long duration.

tooltips.name: Disrupt
tooltips.description: Aether unleashes a blast of Rift energies, dealing damage and slowing enemies, and disjointing projectiles for all nearby allies.  Monoliths will cast this ability as well.

tooltips.name: Monolith
tooltips.description:
Aether summons forth a Monolith that buffs allies and debuffs enemies, granting vision in a small area. Monoliths cast Disrupt when Aether does.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
tooltips.aghanim_description: Allows up to 3 Monoliths to be placed. They must be a minimum distance apart.

tooltips.name: Reality Shift
tooltips.description: Aether drags all nearby units from this plane to the next temporarily, returning after the duration ends, and damaging and stunning enemy units within range that were not affected by the initial cast.  Units affected are out of game and invulnerable for the duration.
tooltips.Note0: Does not affect buildings.
tooltips.Note1: Has a delay time of 0.2s, but an instant cast time.

tooltips.name: Teleport
tooltips.description: The targeted allied unit is teleported to Aether's position after a short delay.  Aether can target herself to teleport to her Monolith, but the delay time is doubled.  A silenced unit will not be transported.
tooltips.Note0: Teleports the unit to the position Aether was in when the spell was cast, not when the spell ends.

tooltips.name: Alchemise
tooltips.description: Transmutes the target enemy unit into gold, granting the Alchemist a large boost to his bank balance.  Passively grants gold per second.

tooltips.name: Bottle Throw
tooltips.description: The Alchemist consumes the next available consumable item in his inventory, throwing a flask at great distance towards the target enemy.  Depending on the item consumed, the flask has different effects when it lands./n/nEnhanced items have greater effects./n<font color='#6699ff'>TANGO:</font> Deals damage over time./n<font color='#6699ff'>HEALING SALVE:</font> Deals bonus damage./n<font color='#6699ff'>CLARITY:</font> Burns Mana./n<font color='#6699ff'>SMOKE OF DECEIT:</font> Blinds the target, causing them to miss attacks./n<font color='#6699ff'>DUST OF APPEARANCE:</font> Slows and grants true sight of the unit.

tooltips.name: Enhance
tooltips.description: Enhances the first available consumable item in the Alchemist's inventory, turning it into a far more potent version of the original.  Sometimes, however, the item won't be quite what you expected...
tooltips.Note0: Can enhance Healing Salves, Clarities, Tangoes and Dust of Appearance.

tooltips.name: MOTHERLOADS!!
tooltips.description: The Alchemist blesses a target ally with a strange magick, causing them to gain bonus gold from any units they kill based on the unit's bounty.  Denies also grant gold.
tooltips.Note0: The unit still grants its normal bounty as well as the bonus gold.

tooltips.name: Elandra's Blessing
tooltips.Description: Blesses the target ally with bonus attack damage and Armor. When they are struck by an enemy, the attacker takes Magical damage based on the blessed ally's main Attribute.

tooltips.name: Godfall
tooltips.description: Unleashing the true power of the Godslayer, after a short channeling Duration, the next attack Alexander makes deals bonus Pure damage as a percentage of his attack damage, healing him for the damage dealt if the target was a Hero. This skill purges positive buffs from the enemy. Deals 5x damage to illusions./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
tooltips.aghanim_description: Reduces cooldown, and Godfall applies Soulseal to all enemies within a 325 radius when the attack lands.

tooltips.name: Radiant
tooltips.description: Alexander is bathed in an unearthly light, a magick used oft by Paladins.  Causes opponents to miss attacks, as he rapidly recovers health over time.

tooltips.name: Soulseal
tooltips.description: Seals away the target's soul with the power of the Godslayer to slow, prevent them from casting spells, and break their passives for a short time.
tooltips.Note0: Purgable.

tooltips.name: Greater Vitality
tooltips.description: Alexander gains bonus damage and Armor based on the amount of Health he has. The more Health, the larger the bonuses.

tooltips.name: Energy Burst
tooltips.description: Creates a blast of energy that deals large damage to nearby enemies, as Alroth takes half the damage he dealt.
tooltips.Note0: Prevents Alroth's health from dropping below 1 for 0.2s.

tooltips.name: Raze
tooltips.description: Alroth creates an unstable maelstrom that deals damage over time to units caught within it.
tooltips.Note0: Deals damage immediately on cast, then every second thereafter until it finishes.

tooltips.name: Shatter
tooltips.description: Alroth's strikes break through the enemy's defenses, causing them to lose Magic Resistance and take bonus Magical damage based upon his attack damage.  Enemies hit by this will lose Mana equal to double the damage taken.

tooltips.name: Solcharge
tooltips.description: Gathering the energies of the Planes, Alroth surrounds himself with a sphere of pure devastation, flying with speed at the targeted enemy.  Upon arrival, he deals large Magical damage in an AoE and stuns units caught in the centre of the explosion.
tooltips.Note0: Has a minimum travel time of 0.5s.

tooltips.name: Solcharge
tooltips.description: Gathering the energies of the Planes, Alroth surrounds himself with an aura of pure devastation, dealing massive damage over time to nearby enemies. Lasts 4s.

tooltips.name: Giga Graviton
tooltips.description: Every 7s, the Ancient unleashes a pulse of devastating energy that instantly kills all creeps in a large radius, and deals Pure damage equal to 12% of all nearby enemy Heroes' Max Health. Only activates when under 33%% of its Max Health.
tooltips.Note0: Deals the damage to each creep at random within a 2.5s interval when the timer hits zero.

tooltips.name: Last Resort
tooltips.description: Upon dipping below 10%% health, as a final attempt to save itself, the Ancient resummons its dead Heroes and grants them invulnerability to damage, restoring their, and nearby other buildings', Health and Mana for a short time, within a large radius.

tooltips.name: Ancient
tooltips.description: This structure gains bonuses and deals damage over time to nearby enemies.

tooltips.name: Naturalise
tooltips.Description: The Artificer temporarily reduces the target's form to their natural state, causing them to lose all bonus Armor and Magic Resistance from abilities and items, and a flat amount of attack damage.

tooltips.name: Replica
tooltips.Description: The Artificer moulds a near-perfect replica of the target ally or enemy. Creates an illusion copy of the target ally or enemy Hero, but it cannot cast spells or use items./n/nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
tooltips.aghanim_Description: Causes enemies killed by Artificer to spawn weaker Replicas automatically.

tooltips.name: Reshape
tooltips.Description: Summoning voidal energies to do his bidding, the Artificer quickly transmogrifies the target enemy into an immobile statue. The statue takes half damage from everything.

tooltips.name: Unmaking
tooltips.Description: The Artificer lobs Nothingness at the target enemy, eating away at their very existence. Deals bonus Magical damage and then Magical damage over time based upon the target's Current Health.

tooltips.name: Black Insignia
tooltips.description: Upon striking an opponent a number of times, he removes a portion of their Health and stuns them, gaining bonus attack speed and Pure damage on his attacks for a short time afterwards. While this ability is on cooldown, he cannot increment marks on any target.

tooltips.name: Erase
tooltips.description: Astaroth calls upon Abyssal energies to slowly erase the target's existence, dealing damage to Health and Current Health, and Mana and Current Mana, over a large duration.

tooltips.name: Overwhelm
tooltips.description: Astaroth forces energies into the target unit.  After 2s, the unit creates an explosion that deals large Magical damage to itself and the units around it.

tooltips.name: Pain Curse
tooltips.description: Afflicts the target unit with a curse that lowers their pain threshold. Causes them to be slowed for a short time, and take bonus damage, whenever they are affected by a damage instance. Has an internal cooldown on the slow.

tooltips.name: Pain Transferral
tooltips.description: Puts a curse on the target unit, causing them to be slowed every time they take damage. The slow has an internal cooldown.

tooltips.name: Axial Seal
tooltips.description: Baal seals a target allied or enemy unit away, killing them instantly and creating an Axial Seal.  Axial Seals can attack enemies.  Each level in this ability causes them to grow stronger.

tooltips.name: Compress
tooltips.description: Compresses the target unit, turning them into a carriable orb.  The orb can be thrown by casting Fire, and deals damage in an AoE upon landing.  If Baal does not throw the orb before the timer reaches zero, it explodes, damaging him and stunning him.  Lasts 3.5s max.

tooltips.name: Compression Sphere
tooltips.Description: Creates an area in which Baal's allies can move freely, but his enemies are slowed the longer they remain within it. Applies a stacking slow to turnrate, movespeed and attackspeed over its duration. The slow is unique to the unit within it, and leaving the sphere will reset the stacks.

tooltips.name: Fire
tooltips.description: Fires the orb at the target area.

tooltips.name: Otherworld
tooltips.description: Baal enters a parallel dimension, unable to be detected by enemies, becoming immune to Physical damage and attacks but taking bonus Magical damage.  He is still able to cast spells, and gains bonus movespeed, but cannot attack or use any items.  Can be cancelled at any time during use.
